Job Title: Junior Project Manager for Development Framework Contracts (m/f/d)
Job Description:
GOPA Tech GmbH
Powering Progress ‚Äì Building Futures
¬†
Shaping Infrastructure¬†
for a Better Tomorrow
¬†
GOPA Tech is an integral part of GOPA, a trusted partner in international development for over 60 years. We harness and direct GOPA‚Äôs energy and infrastructure expertise, advancing a comprehensive approach to shaping a better tomorrow.


                            


                                You will be responsible for interpreting Terms of Reference, identifying and engaging qualified experts, and ensuring that every proposal meets the highest standards before being presented to the client. You will work closely with GOPA Tech SIA Executive Director. You will drive the process with energy, precision, and a commitment to excellence, taking ownership of each assignment and ensuring timely, high-quality results.
Role Overview
Operating at the heart of a rapidly evolving international project environment, you will be responsible for overseeing the entire process from understanding client requests and Terms of Reference (ToR), expert identification, methodology development, proposal preparation, submission, and ensuring high-quality implementation and reporting. You will serve as the key contact for partners, experts, and the Contracting Authority, ensuring that all deliverables meet the highest standards of technical and financial quality, and that processes are consistent with consortium procedures.
Key Responsibilities
Leadership & Coordination
Lead and manage the FWCs, ensuring effective coordination between project management, technical, financial, and administrative functions.
Supervise and mentor FWC Assistants, Recruiters, and support staff.
Foster a collaborative, solution-oriented, and high-performance culture within the team.
Request & Assignment Management
Oversee the management of individual Requests for Services (RfS), ensuring timely and accurate response to client needs.
Analyze and interpret ToRs, coordinate preparation of technical and financial offers, and ensure rigorous quality control prior to submission.
Liaise with consortium members and technical leads to develop tailored methodologies and innovative approaches for each assignment.
Expert Management
Identify, negotiate, and contract high-quality experts; ensure CVs are tailored to assignment requirements.
Oversee logistical arrangements, onboarding, and briefing of experts on assignment-specific procedures and GCF standards.
Ensure compliance with contractual, tax, and social security obligations for all experts.
Technical Backstopping & Quality Assurance
Organize technical briefings, peer-reviews, and regular meetings to support expert teams and ensure deliverables meet state-of-the-art standards.
Conduct multi-level quality reviews of all outputs for accuracy, consistency, completeness, and clarity.
Ensure deliverables conform to ToR, project methodologies, and internal procedures.
Financial Management
Prepare, review, and submit detailed financial proposals and budgets, ensuring compliance with GCF and consortium eligibility criteria.
Oversee project expenditure, invoicing, and financial reporting in coordination with the Financial Manager.
Ensure prompt and accurate payment processes, linked to deliverable approval.
Client & Stakeholder Engagement
Serve as the principal point of contact for the Contracting Authority and consortium partners regarding contractual, financial, and operational matters.
Maintain proactive and transparent communication with all stakeholders throughout the project cycle.
Support client relationship management, briefing/debriefing sessions, and ensure client satisfaction.
Reporting & Documentation
Prepare and submit regular progress and annual reports, synthesizing outcomes and lessons learned.
Maintain comprehensive project documentation, ensuring confidentiality and compliance with consortium agreements.
Contribute to continuous improvement of FWC processes and procedures.


University degree in project management, business administration, environmental sciences, international relations, or a related field.
Less than 3 years of relevant experience in managing international technical assistance projects, preferably within climate finance or donor-funded programmes.
Demonstrated experience in managing FWC requests, proposal development, and expert recruitment.

While Your Peers Are Still Reading Academic Papers About AI, You Could Be Deploying It.
You've spent the last year watching generative AI evolve from interesting demos to genuinely transformative technology. You're not just reading the Anthropic release notes‚Äîyou're already using Claude, GPT-5.1, and every new model that drops to see what's actually possible.
You've automated parts of your own workflow. You've seen exactly how this technology could transform entire industries and the way work in the future. But there's a gap between what you're experimenting with in your dorm room and what's happening in real businesses at scale.
That gap is your opportunity.
Most companies are still forming "AI working groups" and debating governance frameworks.
We're different.
We're shipping AI features for millions of users monthly.
We're re-engineering business processes around AI capabilities.
We're building tools that our 100+ person team uses daily.
And we need someone who gets it‚Äîsomeone who understands this is the biggest platform shift since mobile, and wants to prepare themselves for this new world.
YOUR ROLE
You'll work directly with our Chief Innovation Officer to introduce generative AI across four critical areas:
Research & Opportunity Discovery
Business Process Re-engineering
Internal AI Tooling
Executive Support & Strategic Enablement
This isn't a¬†"shadow executives and make coffee" internship.
You'll have real autonomy, real problems to solve, and real impact on a platform serving millions of users.
This is the first rung on a new career ladder‚Äîone that still exists and leads somewhere meaningful.
WHAT YOU'LL NEED
The Essentials
Top-tier academic foundation
Track emerging AI capabilities as they're released (new models, techniques, frameworks)
Translate ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs technically possible‚Äù into ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs strategically valuable for JobLeads‚Äù
Create concise opportunity briefs that get from idea to decision fast
Stay ahead of the curve on what's coming (not just what's here)
Analyze how teams currently work and identify AI transformation opportunities
Don't just automate existing processes‚Äîreimagine them entirely around AI capabilities
Work with cross-functional teams to understand pain points and bottlenecks
Build business cases showing what‚Äôs possible with AI-first workflows
Contribute to internal AI tools (prompt libraries, evaluation frameworks, internal agents)
Test new capabilities with real use cases across the company
Help non-technical teams adopt AI in their workflows
Document what works, what doesn‚Äôt, and why
Prepare decision-ready materials for leadership (decks, memos, analyses)
Coordinate cross-departmental AI projects and keep initiatives moving
Act as a force multiplier for executive bandwidth‚Äînot an assistant
Remove friction so leadership can focus on high-impact decisions
Currently studying or recently graduated from a leading university
Genuine AI enthusiasm‚Äînot hype
Strategic thinking + execution bias
Professional maturity
Nice to Have (But Seriously, These Matter)
Fields: Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Business + Tech, Economics, or related analytical disciplines
Demonstrated academic excellence
Frequent user of AI tools (Claude, ChatGPT, Cursor, etc.)
Personal projects with LLMs (even small ones‚Äîjust show you ship)
Follow model releases and research for fun
Understand ‚Äúcontext window‚Äù and ‚Äúcontext engineering‚Äù
Ability to see both strategic implications and implementation details
Bias toward action over meetings
Comfortable dissecting complex technical concepts (with AI help)
Comfortable with ambiguity, rapid iteration, and intense workloads
Full-time commitment (40h/week) for 6‚Äì12 months (students) or permanent (graduates)
Available to start within 1‚Äì3 months
Independent, self-directed researcher
Strong English communication
Basic coding (Python, JavaScript, or similar) is a major plus

Understanding of context engineering, prompt engineering
Prior fast-paced tech company experience
Portfolio of AI projects (GitHub, blog, demos)
Contributions to AI communities or open-source
WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT
Blunt truth: Most "AI internships" are hedges. They'll have you do market research, maybe build a POC that never ships, then send you back to school with a nice resume line.
We're not hedging.
AI is core to our product strategy, and you‚Äôll be working directly with our CIO at the highest strategic level‚Äînot buried in hierarchy.
WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT ON BOARD
If You're Still Studying
6‚Äì12 month immersive experience at the forefront of applied AI
Work that forms the foundation of a killer portfolio
Direct mentorship from leadership with investment banking & top-tier consulting backgrounds
Real equity in the outcomes‚Äîyour work ships to millions
Competitive compensation
If You're a Recent Graduate
Permanent role as Entrepreneur in Residence
Help shape AI strategy for a company with millions of users
Build expertise that will be invaluable when companies finally catch up
Work directly with C-level leadership
Remote-first flexibility (or Hamburg office)
Competitive salary
Portfolio-building opportunities
AI-empowered culture: 100+ people executing on AI strategy
Super international team, zero bureaucracy
Company perks: Annual company summer getaway + team meetups across the EU
WHY THIS ROLE MATTERS FOR YOUR CAREER
The working world is changing faster than universities can adapt.
Entry-level roles are disappearing‚ÄîAI is taking over tasks juniors used to do. The bottom rungs of the career ladder are being removed.

About Us
We are looking for Data Scientists that are passionate about the power of AI and who thrive at the intersection of business, analytics, and AI: someone who not only trains models but also deeply understands the business context in which they're applied.
About this role ‚Äì Domains Department
The Data Science Domains Department powers business-critical decision-making across four key areas of enterprise operations. We build and deploy AI-driven features that transform how business leaders understand and act on complex data challenges in their specific domains.
Our Four Domains:
Finance (FIN):
 We enable smarter, faster financial decision-making across the enterprise by partnering with Finance teams to improve forecasting accuracy, planning agility, and financial transparency through AI-driven solutions.
Manufacturing & Supply Chain (M&S):
 We optimize the end-to-end manufacturing and supply chain with cutting-edge AI ‚Äì from helping pharmaceutical companies avoid out-of-stocks to reducing machine breakdown in consumer goods factories.
Research & Development (R&D):
 We partner closely with pharmaceutical and biotech companies to deliver innovative AI-driven solutions that optimize clinical trial recruitment and accelerate pipeline innovation.
Cross-Functional (XF):
 We apply AI to diverse functions spanning procurement, people analytics, commercial operations, and more ‚Äì developing solutions that transform these essential but often underserved areas.


Core responsibilities and skills (by seniority)
Junior Data Scientist ‚Äì Up to 2 years
Build and maintain AI-driven features (forecasting, classification, regression, recommender systems, LLM-powered features) for business use cases
Contribute to app features with guidance from mid/senior teammates; improve models, pipelines and deliverables
Present results and findings to your team; identify gaps and learn to explain the product and the AI behind it
Deliver assigned tasks autonomously and on time with clear ownership
Mid Data Scientist ‚Äì 2+ years
Strong Python/SQL skills, basic MLOps knowledge (Airflow, MLflow, unit testing), and solid ML fundamentals
Own features of the app; constantly improve models, pipelines and monitoring to ensure robust production performance
Communicate and align with internal stakeholders; identify opportunities and explain AI behind business outcomes
Design end-to-end ML pipelines for small projects; mentor junior team members on technical topics
Senior Data Scientist ‚Äì 4+ years
Comprehensive MLOps expertise, advanced Python/SQL skills, and domain specialization; enforce code quality standards across the team
Own key features and projects; design and improve models, pipelines, and experimentation frameworks
Lead 1+ major projects as AI lead with full accountability; break down work, assign tasks, and manage multiple workstreams
Communicate and align with internal/external stakeholders; turn business requirements into AI solutions
Provide technical mentorship; set modeling standards and drive cross-functional delivery
Principal Data Scientist ‚Äì 6+ years
Deep expertise in one technical area; lead by example on technical excellence, business acumen, and strategic vision
Define and own AI domain roadmaps; transform ambiguous business challenges into structured action plans
Lead 5+ simultaneous projects across multiple workstreams; shape product strategy with PM/Eng
Demonstrate strong business acumen: estimate AI solution impact on KPIs and business outcomes
Provide leadership for the Data Science team: mentor and manage; define standards; drive impactful cross-functional delivery
Who we're looking for (all levels)
Someone who thrives at the intersection of business, analytics and AI and wants to ensure AI solves the right problems with measurable impact
A scientist and builder: you explore multiple approaches, analyze results and iterate fast, balancing cutting-edge techniques with simple, scalable solutions
A strong communicator who adapts the message to different audiences and enjoys working cross-functionally with product, engineering and business stakeholders
Someone with a startup mindset: comfortable with ambiguity, proactive and hands-on when something needs fixing or improving
Ready to Lead Boldly ‚Äì helping business leaders make decisive decisions powered by real-time AI insights


What we offer
Work at the forefront of AI-powered decision intelligence in a fast-growing B2B SaaS company
Collaborate with a global team of 300+ talented professionals across Munich, Barcelona, Madrid, Cluj and New York
Tackle real-world business challenges across Finance, Supply Chain, R&D, and Cross-Functional domains
Hybrid work policy (2 days per week in the office) for work-life balance
Permanent contract with competitive compensation
Career growth opportunities across all seniority levels ‚Äì from Junior to Principal Data Scientist
A culture driven by innovation, collaboration, and a commitment to excellence
The chance to Lead Boldly ‚Äì turning complex data into decisions that drive real, measurable impact
Location & Details
Location: Cluj-Napoca, Romania
Contract type: Permanent
Work policy: Hybrid (2 days per week in the office)


For questions about this role, please reach out to our Recruiting team at recruiting@principal33.com.

The Junior Operations Manager ‚Äì Network & Performance is responsible mainly for managing and maintaining the operational performance of data-sourcing systems and service providers. This role ensures the smooth onboarding and performance monitoring of our Points Of Interest (Gas-/Wash stations, EV CPs), pricing and other data sources. It involves close collaboration with partners, support and our BI teams to resolve issues and therefore improve customer satisfaction.
You will be extending our ryd operations team, which operates with a collaborative mindset and also holds shared responsibility for fleet and payment performance. This structure encourages knowledge sharing and provides excellent cross-training opportunities.
The ideal candidate combines strong analytical skills, process-oriented thinking, and excellent communication abilities to support the company‚Äôs operations infrastructure and ensure reliable service for partners and customers.
Your Tasks
Monitoring & Analysis: Monitor point of interest availability and track success rates to identify operational trends and performance bottlenecks.
Partner Management: Communicate effectively with partner support teams to report and resolve performance issues.
Onboarding & Configuration: Handle the end-to-end onboarding of energy stations, ensuring accurate configuration and smooth activation.
Data Quality: Perform regular data validation and quality checks to maintain up-to-date records of station status.
Cross-Functional Support: Support the monitoring of payment transaction flows and assist with Fleet operational tasks (e.g., B2B customer onboarding) when necessary.


Several years of experience in operations, energy management, or partner management ideally in energy, mobility.
You are profound in Excel / Google Sheets, Basic knowledge of SQL is an advantage, but not required.
You have a process-oriented way of thinking, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills for working with internal teams and external partners.
Fluent English ¬†and German (as 95% of our partners are located in the Germany)¬†


#shapingryd is one of our values, as we believe that transforming from Start-up to Scaleup can only be achieved together.
We trust that #bettertogether can only be achieved by you taking ownership from day one.
We want to have our employees with us for the long haul. You get a permanent employment contract, competitive salary and a company pension scheme.¬†
As a Ryder, you work flexibly from home up to two days a week and enjoy three team days in the Munich office (S-Bahn Donnersberger Br√ºcke).¬†
Professional onboarding package and buddies: From day one, you will be part of our monthly onboarding and buddy programme. Special: In addition to a buddy from the team, you will get to know a buddy from another area of the company on your first day, which will make it easier for you to get started with us.
The professional and personal development of our Ryders matters to us. We recognise potential and enhance it. Join us and write your own success story.
Never Stop Learning! You will get a training budget per year that you can freely allocate to our professional development.
You want to work from anywhere for a change? With RydFlex you can work abroad for upto 6 weeks anywhere within the EU.


                            


                                Stefanie Straus
HR Generalist
ryd GmbH | Landsberger Str. 94 | 80339 Munich, Germany |¬†

Looking to gain hands-on experience in financial modelling, M&A, and infrastructure deals that shape the future? You‚Äôve come to the right place.
We‚Äôre looking for a sharp, curious intern to join our 
Project Finance & Infrastructure
 team in Hamburg. As part of our collaborative and international team, you‚Äôll work on real transactions in the 
infrastructure, energy, and renewables
 sectors ‚Äì not just as a spectator, but as a valued contributor.
Eight Advisory was founded in 2009 in France by 8 former partners of Arthur Andersen / Big4 companies as a firm specialized in Transaction Services, Restructuring, and Transformation. Today, Eight Advisory has grown to 950+ employees (including 113 partners) in France, the UK, Belgium, Netherlands, USA (New York), Spain, Germany and Switzerland. Together with the Eight International Network, counting over 650 employees in more than 20 countries, we respond to a growing demand for financial advice from private equity firms, medium- and large-sized corporates, and investment banks.
What you‚Äôll do:
Support financial and transaction advisory projects for 
national and international clients
: project developers, private equity firms, and infrastructure funds.
Learn the nuts and bolts of 
financial modelling, financial engineering, M&A
 and 
debt structuring
 through our learning-by-doing approach.
Work closely with experienced team members and get access to a 
dedicated mentor
 for personal and professional guidance.
Contribute to deals that support the transition to sustainable infrastructure.
Get a head start: 
Outstanding interns may receive an offer to join us permanently
 after graduation.

Eight Advisory was founded in 2009 in France by 8 former partners of Arthur Andersen / Big4 companies as a firm specialized in Transaction Services, Restructuring, and Transformation. Today, Eight Advisory has grown to 950+ employees (including 113 partners) in France, the UK, Belgium, Netherlands, USA (New York), Spain, Germany and Switzerland. Together with the Eight International Network, counting over 650 employees in more than 20 countries, we respond to a growing demand for financial advice from private equity firms, medium- and large-sized corporates, and investment banks.
We are currently looking for an ambitious and diligent individual to join our Transaction Services team in Zurich as an Intern (4-6 months). The Transaction Services team in Zurich mainly provides buy-side and sell-side financial due diligence services to support its private equity and corporate clients in M&A processes.
You will work as a fully integrated team member on buy- and sell-side Financial Due Diligence projects
From the start, you will be given responsibility on our Financial Due Diligence projects and you will receive an in-depth on-the-job training to deepen your understanding of the mechanisms of buy- and sell-side M&A processes.
You will be coached by a mentor who is available at any time to support you with professional or personal advice. Graduates may have the opportunity to be offered a permanent position after a successful internship.

We are currently looking for an ambitious and diligent individual to join our Transaction Services team in Munich or Frankfurt as an Intern (3-6 months). The Transaction Services team in Munich or Frankfurt mainly provides buy-side and sell-side financial due diligence services to support its private equity and corporate clients in M&A processes.
You will support us as fully integrated team member on planning, executing and delivering Transaction Services (primarily Financial Due Diligence in buy- and sell-side transactions) for international and national private equity and corporate clients.
With a full involvement from the beginning to the end you will get an intensive training on the job on our Financial Due Diligence projects to understand the mechanisms of buy- and sell-side M&A processes.
You will be coached by a mentor who is available at any time to support you with professional or personal advice. Graduates may have the opportunity to be offered a permanent position after a successful internship.

As a strategy and management consultancy, we work hand in hand with leading clients from the Automotive & Transport, Energy & Environment, and Public & Infrastructure sectors to shape the future of mobility. We leverage the tools of digital transformation to guide traditional companies into the future and help young businesses establish themselves in the market.
¬†
Since our founding in 2017, we have grown to over 110 employees across eight locations ‚Äì Berlin, Munich, Vienna, Cologne, Stuttgart, Hamburg, Bucharest, and most recently Warsaw. We are proud to have been ranked among the Top Ten in the brandeins/Statista list of ‚ÄúBest Management Consultants‚Äù for the fifth consecutive year.
¬†
What to Expect¬†
The role will be tailored to your talents. Depending on your profile, you will specialize in two to three functional areas and support the others.
Strategy
Contribute to brand roadmap and campaign planning
Assist in conceptual thinking, structuring, and preparation
Editorial preparation and campaign ideas
Analytics
Basic understanding of data and social media performance
Support reporting for LinkedIn, website, and campaigns
Derive simple insights and actionable recommendations
Creation
Design smaller assets such as social cards and slides
Contribute to LinkedIn carousels, event visuals, and team photoshoots
Support video editing, podcast production, or motion design
Digital
Assist with LinkedIn and Meta ads
Maintain CRM lists and simple automations
Manage conversion funnels and landing pages
Website
Maintain 
accilium.com
 and 
accilium.ro
Apply basic SEO logic and update content
Content
Copywriting for LinkedIn
Help develop tone of voice and storytelling
Community management
PR
Support press work, award submissions, and speaker management
Events
Prepare and coordinate internal and external events
Briefing, schedule coordination, and post-event coverage

At Acturis, innovation isn‚Äôt just part of our culture - 
it‚Äôs in our DNA
.
Our story began in 2000 
in the garden shed of our co‚Äëfounder, Theo Duchen
, who, alongside fellow former McKinsey partner David McDonald, set out to reinvent insurance technology. What started as a bold start‚Äëup idea has grown into a global SaaS leader trusted by the industry.
Today, 
over 100,000 users across 40+ countries
 rely on the Acturis platform. By working closely with brokers, insurers, and MGAs, we continue to shape the market and drive new standards across both personal and commercial lines.
Acturis is proud to be recognised as a 
Great Place to Work¬Æ 2026 
and to maintain a collaborative, innovative, start‚Äëup‚Äëstyle culture, even as we scale globally. With

, this is a place built for early‚Äëcareer talent to thrive. And as an EcoVadis Committed‚Äërated organisation, we focus on creating long‚Äëterm value by operating in a sustainable and responsible way.

, a 
clear progression path
, and real responsibility early on, because we‚Äôve built an environment where graduates grow fast and make meaningful impact.

Addepto is a leading AI consulting (
https://addepto.com/ai-consulting/
) and data engineering (
https://addepto.com/data-engineering-services/
) company that builds scalable, ROI-focused AI solutions for some of the world's largest enterprises and pioneering startups, including Rolls Royce, Continental, Porsche, ABB, and WGU. With an exclusive focus on Artificial Intelligence and Big Data, Addepto helps organizations unlock the full potential of their data through systems designed for measurable business impact and long-term growth.
The company's work extends beyond client engagements. Drawing from real-world challenges and insights, Addepto has developed its own 
product - ContextClue
 - and actively contributes open-source solutions to the AI community. This commitment to transforming practical experience into scalable innovation has earned Addepto recognition by 
Forbes as one of the top 10 AI consulting companies worldwide
.
As part of 
KMS Technology
, a US-based global technology group, Addepto combines deep AI specialization with enterprise-scale delivery capabilities‚Äîenabling the partnership to move clients from AI experimentation to production impact, securely and at scale.
As a 
Junior Data Engineer
, you will have the exciting opportunity to work with a team of technology experts on challenging projects across various industries, leveraging cutting-edge technologies. Here are some of the projects we are seeking talented individuals to join:
Design and development of a universal data platform for global aerospace companies. 
This Azure and Databricks powered initiative combines diverse enterprise and public data sources. The data platform is at the early stages of the development, covering design of architecture and processes as well as giving freedom for technology selection.
Data Platform Transformation for energy management association body. 
This project addressed critical data management challenges, boosting user adoption, performance, and data integrity. The team is implementing a comprehensive data catalog, leveraging Databricks and Apache Spark/PySpark, for simplified data access and governance. Secure integration solutions and enhanced data quality monitoring, utilizing Delta Live Table tests, established trust in the platform. The intermediate result is a user-friendly, secure, and data-driven platform, serving as a basis for further development of ML components.
Design of the data transformation and following data ops pipelines for global car manufacturer.
 This project aims to build a data processing system for both real-time streaming and batch data. We‚Äôll handle data for business uses like process monitoring, analysis, and reporting, while also exploring LLMs for chatbots and data analysis. Key tasks include data cleaning, normalization, and optimizing the data model for performance and accuracy.
üöÄ Your main responsibilities:
Design scalable data processing pipelines for streaming and batch processing using Big Data technologies like Databricks, Airflow and/or Dagster.
Contribute to the development of CI/CD and MLOps processes.
Develop applications to aggregate, process, and analyze data from diverse sources.
Collaborate with the Data Science team on Machine Learning projects, including text/image analysis and predictive model building.
Develop and organize data transformations using Databricks/DBT and Apache Airflow.
Translate business requirements into technical solutions and ensure optimal performance and quality.

About Us
DeepSea is a maritime technology leader, providing a unified optimisation platform that helps shipping companies cut fuel consumption, reduce emissions, and transform vessel performance across entire fleets.
Built on the most advanced maritime AI data pool in the world, DeepSea‚Äôs platform powers everything from vessel monitoring to advanced automation - helping clients achieve measurable results with clarity, speed and scale.
We are trusted by some of the world‚Äôs most forward-thinking ship owners and operators, and our team spans Greece, the UK, Armenia, Romania, Singapore and Japan. As the shipping industry undergoes enormous change, we are at the centre of that transition - helping our customers take control, reduce risk, and build competitive advantage.
About the position
We are looking for an experienced Front End Developer to join our team. You will develop intuitive products and internal tools based on user, product and business requirements, in collaboration with your Team Leader, Back End Software team, Architect and Product Department.
Our products are used by shipping company engineers and captains to optimise the technical operations and navigation of their vessels based on our in-house developed AI and optimisation algorithms. You will need to gain a good understanding of the domain and our research output to design improvements that make our backend infrastructure scalable and cover our customers‚Äô needs.
Main responsibilities:
Deliver intuitive and visually appealing user interfaces that enhance usability and overall user experience.
Develop and maintain React-based frontend applications with clean, scalable, and maintainable code.
Integrate frontend components with backend services, including in-house AI and optimization algorithms for vessel technical operations and navigation.
Optimize application performance to ensure fast load times, responsiveness, and smooth interactions.
Collaborate closely with backend engineers, architects, and DevOps teams to deliver end‚Äëto‚Äëend product features.
Leverage modern development tools and AI‚Äëassisted coding workflows to improve productivity and code quality.
Work with modern build tools and development workflows to ensure efficient delivery and high-quality releases.

The Reality:
 We're not running a structured internship program. However, if your background is deeply connected to our work in AI for physical-world engineering - think computational fluid dynamics, multi-physics simulation, structural mechanics, or similar technical domains - we want to hear from you.
We're looking for exceptional people whose expertise aligns closely with what we're building, not general software engineering or AI internships.

EBASE
, including an in-house scripting course. You‚Äôll set your first steps as a consultant helping the customer to further optimize the use of our product. Within 2‚Äì4 weeks, you will join a client team and begin working on scripting assignments. By executing small technical tasks, you‚Äôll quickly learn to navigate EBASE and client interfaces, gradually building expertise while contributing to client satisfaction.
In this role, you‚Äôll be actively involved in a wide variety of tasks, from troubleshooting¬†and scripting¬†to analysis, client support, testing, and documentation. Depending on the team setup, you may also interact directly with clients. During the first year you will gradually take on more complex responsibilities, gain client-facing experience, and grow into a generalist with deep knowledge of our products and the energy market, with guidance from senior team members,
Typical tasks include:
Managing issues in EBASE, debugging scripts, and testing new releases
Designing small functionalities through fit-gap analysis (AS-IS vs. TO-BE)
Consulting on TO-BE situations after analyzing market documentation
Rolling out new releases
Providing ad hoc support to clients with operational issues

About Fixico
We are Fixico, a fast-growing car damage repair marketplace, backed by world-class Silicon Valley-based investors, and scaling up rapidly throughout Europe. Trusted by fleet owners, leasing, rental, and insurance companies. Fixico has managed hundreds of thousands of repairs for companies ranging from the world's biggest brands to local players.
What you will be doing
As a Business Operations Intern you will be joining our Operations team. The team aims to provide the best possible support to our customers, partners and repair shops in our network. Main activities surround building long lasting relationships with stakeholders and aid in solving any problems that might arise.
You will handle all incoming and outgoing communication with our B2B clients Dutch speaking, arrange the best deals with repair shops for our B2B clients and handle questions from clients and drivers via mail, chat or phone. Next to that you are the one reaching out to clients to help them make a choice and book an appointment to repair their car damages.
We offer 
two internship cycles
, each lasting 
5-6 months
:
Fall Cycle:
 Starts in 
September
Spring Cycle:
 Starts in 
February or March
Your Responsibilities
Managing B2B accounts
Optimizing all processes and volumes for the accounts
Arrange the best and fastest quotes for our B2B clients
Processing all B2B damages, including quality assurance and damage reports
Onboarding new partnerships and educating your account on the best use of Fixico
Being the point of contact for all operational communication with partners and their drivers regarding damage repairs
Establishing and strengthening relationships with different partners, such as international leasing and rental companies
Ensuring a smooth and timely repair experience for our clients
Tracking and solving repair issues

Ben jij nauwkeurig, analytisch en krijg je energie van het begeleiden van logistieke processen over de grens? Heb je al basiskennis van douaneprocessen en wil je je verder ontwikkelen tot zelfstandig declarant? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou voor de functie van 
(Junior) Douane Declarant 
binnen ons team in Nederland, onderdeel van een internationale groep die scheepvaart-, logistieke en maritieme diensten aanbiedt.
¬†
Je werkt in een dynamische omgeving waarin je ervoor zorgt dat douaneformaliteiten correct en tijdig worden afgehandeld. Je werkt zelfstandig aan aangiftes, schakelt veel met collega‚Äôs van de exportafdeling en denkt mee over procesverbeteringen.
¬†
Wat ga je doen?
In deze veelzijdige functie ben je verantwoordelijk voor:
Het zelfstandig voorbereiden van douaneaangiftes (import, export en transit).
Het controleren van documenten zoals facturen, paklijsten en vervoersdocumenten.
Het uitvoeren van wekelijkse checks in ons douanesysteem.
Het signaleren van fouten of risico‚Äôs en hier direct op acteren.
Het oplossen van operationele vraagstukken die tijdens zendingen ontstaan.
Het meedenken over slimmer en effici√´nter inrichten van douaneprocessen.
Intensieve samenwerking met de exportafdeling om het proces soepel te laten verlopen.
Deze functie biedt de mogelijkheid om je te ontwikkelen tot volledig zelfstandig declarant.

Who are we?
Private markets have more potential than ever, yet are harder to win. Deal teams need a better system, not more tools.
Gain is the private markets super app that connects AI-powered research, human-verified insight, and your team‚Äôs proprietary intelligence in one platform, helping leading PE, advisory, and consulting teams source smarter, collaborate seamlessly, and execute with conviction.
Today, the world‚Äôs leading private equity firms, advisors, and consultants use Gain to source smarter, collaborate seamlessly, and execute with greater confidence
Gain is trusted across more than $1 trillion of private capital, used by 100% of MBB and Big Four firms, and by over 70% of the world‚Äôs top 20 M&A advisory houses.
Gain has been recognised as US Data Provider of the Year (PE Wire), Global Financial Market Review‚Äôs Best Use of AI in Finance, one of Sifted‚Äôs Top 100 Fastest-Growing Companies, and ranked in the Deloitte Technology Fast 50. Gain operates globally with offices in New York, London, Amsterdam, Frankfurt, Warsaw, and Bangalore.
What will you do?
Profile and analyse businesses by collecting and processing their financials along with drawing up business, market, ownership and M&A track record overviews
Form integrated views on platform and add-on deal opportunities for leading private equity clients across Europe, with our technology supporting and enriching your insights¬†
Support research initiatives and learn about specific niche sectors we analyse on a weekly basis
Support side projects for research purposes (e.g. long lists)
What do we offer?
Competitive compensation package, private medical care and sport card
High-growth fintech scale-up with an international footprint
Flexibility to leeway around exam periods or deadlines
Hybrid working model, with flexible access to our Warsaw office
Clear development path supported by lots of coaching and a feedback-driven approach
Unmatched learning and career preparation opportunities for private equity, investment banking or consulting
Culture of trust, ownership and standard of excellence
Fun working atmosphere with company-wide outings and events
What do you need to join us?
Experience
 ‚Äì you are a Master, 2nd or 3rd-year Bachelor student with internship experience in private equity, investment banking or strategy consulting
Education
 ‚Äì you have consistently achieved excellent results from a leading university in economics, business or a quantitative field
Investment enthusiasm 
‚Äì you showcase a strong interest in finance and appreciate world-class investment research and in-depth analyses
Languages
 ‚Äì you are a fluent English speaker, other languages are a plus
Availability
 ‚Äì you are available at least 20 h/w or ready to take on a full-time job (full-time availability for the first 2 weeks ‚Äì required)

Bouw mee aan scherpe projectsturing in de energietransitie!
HoSt is een internationaal opererende, technologiegedreven organisatie in de energietransitie. Vanuit Nederland ontwikkelen, bouwen en exploiteren wij oplossingen voor bio-energie, biogas en duurzame warmte. Met teams Nederland, Frankrijk, de Verenigde Staten, Polen en Letland en projecten in heel Europa en Amerika groeit HoSt snel en internationaal. Onze ambitie is groot: 25 miljoen ton CO‚ÇÇ-reductie realiseren via onze projecten en installaties wereldwijd.
Die groei vraagt om steeds betere financi√´le sturing van onze projecten. Niet alleen achteraf rapporteren, maar begrijpen wat er gebeurt, daarvan leren en dit vertalen naar betere keuzes. Daarom breiden we ons team Business Control uit met een 
Junior
 
Project Analyst
.
De Functie
Als Junior Project Analyst rapporteer je aan de 
Manager Business Control
 en werk je nauw samen met het team Business Control, de teams in de Business Units en de directie. Dit is een junior ontwikkelrol voor iemand die zich graag breed wil ontwikkelen en interesse heeft in het snijvlak van business, finance en data.
Je helpt projectinformatie te structureren, voert analyses uit op project- en portfolio‚Äëniveau en draagt bij aan betere rapportages en dashboards. Binnen de projecten wordt gebruikt gemaakt van onze innovatieve oplossingen, wat initi√´le begrotingen soms minder voorspelbaar maakt. Juist daarom is het belangrijk om snel te leren van de praktijk en inzichten effectief terug te brengen in nieuwe keuzes en ramingen.
Dit is nadrukkelijk een functie waarin je leert door te doen: je krijgt verantwoordelijkheid, begeleiding en veel ruimte om jezelf professioneel en persoonlijk te ontwikkelen. Afhankelijk van jouw interesse en ontwikkeling kun je doorgroeien richting business control, project control of andere finance- en analyse-rollen binnen HoSt.
Wat ga je doen
Je ondersteunt Business Control en directie met analyses die direct bijdragen aan betere projectsturing en scherpere commerci√´le keuzes. De kern van de rol is het versterken en verkorten van de feedback loop: leren van project-actuals en deze inzichten terugbrengen naar commercie en nieuwe begrotingen.
Je houdt je onder andere bezig met:
Uitvoeren van diepgaande financi√´le analyses op individuele projecten (w.o. tijd, kosten, scope, kwaliteit);
Analyseren hoe projecten en begrotingsposten zich financieel ontwikkelen na contractering, inclusief afwijkingen ten opzichte van de initi√´le begroting;
Signaleren van risico‚Äôs, knelpunten en afwijkingen binnen de projecten;
Inzichtelijk maken waar en waarom marge onder druk komt of juist beter uitpakt en hoe we dat verbeteren;
Opstellen van project- en portfolio-analyses die patronen en trends zichtbaar maken;
Vertalen van project-actuals naar concrete inzichten voor nieuwe calculaties en commerci√´le besluitvorming, in samenwerking met business control en commercie;
Bijdragen aan heldere rapportages en dashboards (o.a. Power BI) die deze inzichten ondersteunen.

Start your career as an Junior Electrical Engineer and work on technology that supports the global energy transition.
About us
Bright Renewables
 is a technology provider specializing in renewable gas and CO‚ÇÇ capture solutions. We deliver complete, innovative energy projects used worldwide. Bright Renewables is part of the HoSt Group, a Dutch, family-owned company and a global leader in renewable energy technology.
We are proud winners of the FD Gazelle Silver Award and the Oryx Prize
,
 recognizing us as one of the most inspiring companies in the Netherlands.
Why choose Bright Renewables?
Because you start your engineering career working on real energy projects that contribute to the energy transition. 
You‚Äôll be given trust, responsibility, and strong guidance to help you develop your technical skills in an international and supportive environment.
Your role as a 
Junior Electrical Engineer
As a Junior Electrical Engineer, you will work closely with experienced Electrical and Software Engineers and gradually take on more responsibility. You report to the Manager of E&I and Software and learn by working on real projects from day one.
You‚Äôll be based in Enschede, working alongside more than 400 colleagues. From mid-2026, you‚Äôll move to a brand-new, sustainably built office in Hengelo. You will also support our partner in Poland during container construction and commissioning, giving you valuable international exposure early in your career.
What this means for you:
You receive hands-on training, clear guidance, and the opportunity to grow into a fully independent Electrical Engineer in a future-proof industry
You responsibilities 
Support senior engineers with preparing RFQs and evaluating technical offers;
Assist in communication with clients and suppliers;
Collaborate with Electrical and Software Engineering teams in the Netherlands and Poland;
Prepare load lists, network diagrams, cable lists, and electrical documentation;
Review electrical schematics together with experienced engineers;
Support ATEX and SIL calculations;
Provide technical support during commissioning and start-up of installations.

Job Title: Internship: Everybody Gets Home Safe Everyday

Job Description:
These assignments are for the internship period starting in 2026.
For the Bright department
 we are looking for interns! The following internships / graduation assignments are available. Apply using the apply button and select the (graduation)¬†internship¬†you are interested in.
The internships on this page are:
1: 
Ergonomic and Maintainability Assessment of Biogas Upgrading and CO‚ÇÇ Liquefaction Plants;
2: Transient system model;
3: Upgrader Test Setup Pre-treatment Compact.
1 Ergonomic and Maintainability Assessment of Biogas Upgrading and CO‚ÇÇ Liquefaction Plants
Suitable for BSc and MSc in 
Industrial design engineer, ¬†Industrieel Product Ontwerpen (IPO) or any other studies that involve ergonomic studies
The intern will assess the ergonomic design, reachability, and maintainability of existing biogas upgrading and CO‚ÇÇ liquefaction installations. Systems will be evaluated against relevant occupational health and safety standards (e.g., ARBO norms). Based on findings, the intern will develop improvement proposals and design recommendations to enhance serviceability, safety, and operational efficiency.
Your tasks:
Review current Biogas upgrading and CO2 liquefaction plants based on reachability and maintainability and come with proposals of an improved design;
Test current service and maintenance procedures with respect to applicable standards (ARBO for example).
‚Äî
2 Transient system model.
Suitable for 
MSc in Chemical Engineering / Mechanical Engineering / Sustainable Energy
In this assignment you will work on the development of a fully dynamic model of the methanol reactor system in development at Bright Renewables. Continuing from work of previous interns your task will be to integrated the stand alone models in a total system, and find the appropriate control strategy.
Your tasks:
Complete dynamical models of sub systems;
Develop integrated model of al dynamic sub-models;
Set-up control system for the overall plant;
Analyse results and develop control strategies.
‚Äî
3 Upgrader Test Setup Pre-treatment Compact.
Suitable for 
BSc / MSc / MBO-4
 
in Electrical
 
Engineering
For the redesign of our Upgrader Compact we would like to have an easy way of testing the pre-treatment skid. For this we would like to have a small test panel been made that can be easily connected to this skid. You will be working in the E&I and Software department of Bright Renewables.
Your tasks:
Analyze the new pre-treatment skid;
Design a test panel;
Get the test panel build;
Perform the actual test.

Job Title: Internship - Automotive Sales & Product Trainer - Belgium
Job Description:
Ontdek jouw toekomst in de Automotive Sector!
Ben jij een laatstejaarsstudent met een passie voor innovatie, technologie en mobiliteit? Zoek jij nog een stageplek die echt in jou investeert & waar je de kans krijgt om aan interessante projecten te werken? 
Bij 
IAS (Innovative Automotive Services)
 krijg je de kans om √©cht impact te maken! Ontdek hoe jouw talent bijdraagt aan de toekomst van mobiliteit en leer van de beste in de automotive sector.
Over IAS
IAS is d√© toonaangevende partner in Learning & Development binnen de automotive wereld. Wij werken samen met topmerken om innovatieve, wetenschappelijk onderbouwde trainingsoplossingen te cre√´ren.

: Geen koffie halen of kopietjes maken bij ons! Jij werkt actief mee aan trainingen, analyses en het opstellen van opleidingsmateriaal.

: Je krijgt de kans om te werken met toonaangevende automerken.

: We laten je niet verdrinken. Je wordt begeleid door ervaren professionals en krijgt de kans om jouw talenten verder te ontwikkelen.

Een fijne balans tussen leren, ervaring op doen en plezier maken: bij ons staat FUN hoog op de agenda!
Flexibele werkuren en de mogelijkheid om remote te werken.

Toffe events: zoals overheerlijke BBQ‚Äôs tijdens de middag, teambuildings op het strand, gamen tijdens de middag (met of zonder VR bril), afterwork drinks (en zoveel meer, ‚Ä¶).
Bij IAS maken we samen het verschil. Spring jij mee aan boord? üöó‚ú®

Word een vertrouwde security-adviseur!
Kick-start je cybersecurity carri√®re in een team waarin je snel leert, vrij kunt groeien en echte impact maakt. Ons Cybersecurity-team groeit hard! We zoeken junior consultants die snel willen ontwikkelen tot allround security-adviseurs. Binnen het team werk je aan een breed scala aan cybersecurityprojecten binnen Financial Services, Healthcare en Retail, ondersteund door collega‚Äôs die geven om jouw ontwikkeling en welzijn.
Deze rol is ideaal als je snel wilt leren,  aan verschillende soorten opdrachten wilt bijdragen en wilt doorgroeien naar volwaardig cybersecurity expert. 
Jouw impact
IG&H werkt voor toonaangevende organisaties in sectoren zoals pensioenen, verzekeringen, retail en gezondheidszorg. Als junior krijg je de mogelijkheid om mee te bouwen aan veilige, toekomstbestendige digitale omgevingen samen met ervaren security specialisten. Jij draagt bij aan de digitale veiligheid van onze klanten √©n van IG&H zelf, terwijl jij je vakmanschap ontwikkelt.
Wat je gaat doen
Je ondersteunt en voert cybersecurity werk uit binnen meerdere opdrachten, waaronder:
Ondersteunen van cybersecurity-assessments en risicoanalyses
Technische bevindingen vertalen naar duidelijke, aanbevelingen
Helpen bij het ontwerpen van veilige architecturen of security-verbeteringen
Samenwerken met senior consultants voor end-to-end delivery
Leren adviseren van management over securitybeslissingen en roadmaps
Je maakt niet alleen slides; je helpt bij het leveren van praktische uitvoering, tastbare verbeteringen en echte verandering bij klanten.

Bij IG&H helpen we onze klanten om voorop te blijven lopen in hun markt. Dat doen we door slimme technologie, data en consultancy te combineren in een wereld die continu verandert. We werken samen, doorbreken silo‚Äôs en bouwen oplossingen waar organisaties √©cht verder mee komen. Sta jij aan het begin van je carri√®re als Data Engineer en wil je hieraan bijdragen? Dan maken we graag kennis met je.
We zijn op zoek naar een Data Engineer om datagedreven producten te ontwerpen, te bouwen en een nieuwe databackbone te cre√´ren voor onze data science-projecten. De Data Engineer zal de lead nemen om onze klanten naar het volgende niveau van datahandling en data-automatiseringsmogelijkheden te brengen. Verder zal je (technische) leiderschapsvaardigheden, ervaring en visie toepassen om effici√´nte datatoepassingen te cre√´ren.¬†¬†
Wij zoeken iemand die:
Onder begeleiding meewerkt aan het ontwerpen en bouwen van herbruikbare datamodellen en data-oplossingen
Datapijplijnen ontwikkelt of onderhoudt (zoals ETL/ELT-processen) en meewerkt aan het opzetten van data lakes en data warehouses
Interesse heeft in het toepassen van analysemethoden en deze stap voor stap in de praktijk leert gebruiken
Wil leren werken met cloudinfrastructuur en bijbehorende data-platformen
Zich wil ontwikkelen binnen een commercieel gerichte en/of consultingomgeving
Graag samenwerkt in teamverband met collega‚Äôs met verschillende expertises
Zich prettig voelt in een omgeving met gemotiveerde mensen die samen streven naar hoge kwaliteit voor klanten
Over het Data & AI team
¬†
Wij helpen onze klanten innoveren en gebruikmaken van de nieuwste data- en AI-technologie. Het Data & AI-team bestaat uit 30 data-experts (Data Scientisten, Analisten en Consultants) die nauw samenwerken met de 30 engineers in ons Technology-team en nog eens 20 datawetenschappers bij de zusterbedrijven van IG&H. Het team levert data science en analytische projecten en heeft in de afgelopen twee jaar meer dan 40 (Gen)AI-projecten gerealiseerd voor onze klanten in Retail, Financial Services en Health.

Wil je je carri√®re een goede kickstart geven door te starten in consultancy? Als Business Analyst Financial Services bij IG&H maak je impact bij toonaangevende, financi√´le dienstverleners en organisaties in Nederland. Je helpt deze organisaties om in te spelen op nieuwe ontwikkelingen en om te gaan met uitdagingen in de markt. Als integraal onderdeel van een team van consultants krijg je vanaf dag √©√©n verantwoordelijkheid: of je nu werkt aan de strategie van onze klanten, gegeven adviezen implementeert of nieuwe oplossingen integreert.
Wat ga je doen?
 
Samen met collega's werk je aan strategieontwikkeling, het integreren van nieuwe oplossingen en digitaliseringsinitiatieven die invloed hebben op financi√´le diensten of producten. Als Junior Consultant Financial Services maak je deel uit van een team van sector-experts dat onze klanten in verzekeringen, pensioenen en banken begeleidt bij hun (digitale) transformatie. We ondersteunen hen bij het transformeren van hun praktijken om concurrerend te blijven en om te gaan met uitdagingen, zoals voortdurend veranderende regelgeving. Je raakt bekend met de nieuwste innovaties op het gebied van data en technologie die als versnellers kunnen worden gebruikt om financi√´le diensten te verbeteren.
Tijdens deze projecten houd je je bezig met klant- en marktanalyse, het voorbereiden van adviesrapporten, het geven van presentaties en workshops, het onderhouden van regelmatig contact met je projectteam en natuurlijk het interacteren met klanten en stakeholders.
Naast het werken met collega's binnen Advisory, kun je deel uitmaken van een 
smart collaboration
 met consultants van andere disciplines, zoals Business Engineering, Data & AI of Transformation, om zo langdurige impact te maken bij en voor onze klanten. Intern werk je vanuit het IG&H-kantoor, ontwikkel je nieuwe voorstellen en draag je bij aan de expertise van het bedrijf.
Wat levert het jou op?
¬†
Werken bij IG&H zal je carri√®re een vliegende start geven door een steile leercurve. Naast leren op de werkvloer zijn er volop trainingsmogelijkheden om je kernvaardigheden op het gebied van consultancy en interpersoonlijke vaardigheden te versterken via onze Junior Academy. Je krijgt toegewezen coaches die je begeleiden. Daarnaast biedt IG&H een inspirerend kantoor in Utrecht, een positieve werksfeer, leuke teamactiviteiten en sportevenementen.¬†
"Bij IG&H kun je je persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling versnellen in een ondersteunende en veilige omgeving. Je wordt omringd door intelligente collega's die je dagelijks uitdagen, terwijl je ook de vrijheid hebt om je eigen leerpad vorm te geven. Binnen FS word je blootgesteld aan de nieuwste ontwikkelingen en trends, waardoor je een sector-expert wordt en dus over de juiste kennis beschikt om bedrijven te helpen voorop te blijven lopen."
 Samuel Tielkes (Consultant Financial Services)
"
Bij IG&H voel je je meteen welkom als je begint. Er zijn veel leuke evenementen om je collega's te leren kennen; georganiseerd zowel door het bedrijf als door collega's zelf. Binnen het FS-team wissel je als consulant tussen projecten die gericht zijn op de verzekerings-, bank- en pensioensector. Dit stelt je in staat om je te verdiepen in de verschillende sectoren en te ontdekken waar je interesses liggen. Samen met collega's van het FS-team (en competentieteams) werk je naar een succesvol resultaat."
 Iris B√∂hm (Consultant Financial Services)

Als Business Analyst Retail & Products bij IG&H maak je impact bij toonaangevende Nederlandse bedrijven in de retail- en consumentengoederensector. Je helpt deze organisaties om in te spelen op nieuwe ontwikkelingen en om te gaan met uitdagingen in de markt. Wat ga je doen?
Binnen het Retail & Products-team word je onderdeel van een diverse groep van getalenteerde en gedreven mensen, met wie je nauw samenwerkt om onze klanten optimaal te bedienen.
Er is geen ‚Äòtypisch‚Äô project binnen het team. Door nauwe samenwerking met andere expertteams binnen IG&H kunnen we onze klanten helpen met vrijwel elke uitdaging in het competitieve retaillandschap. Van strategieontwikkeling tot implementatie en integratie van in-house ontwikkelde oplossingen. We zijn trots op onze end-to-end transformaties en op het feit dat we echt een partner zijn voor onze klanten tijdens deze reis. De onderwerpen vari√´ren van korte projecten om prijsstrategie√´n te verbeteren tot grootschalige trajecten om de werkwijze in een Nederlands magazijn aan te passen. Deze uiteenlopende opdrachten worden uitgevoerd voor een nog diverser klantenbestand: van retail tot e-commerce, logistieke dienstverleners, industri√´le producenten, FMCG-bedrijven, verhuurbedrijven, en meer.
In je eerste twee jaar als analist bij IG&H krijg je de kans om aan een breed scala aan projecten te werken, zodat je je vaardigheden optimaal kunt ontwikkelen.
Als business analyst speel je een cruciale rol in de dagelijkse ondersteuning van het projectteam. Je taken vari√´ren van analytisch probleemoplossen tot klantgerichte werkzaamheden, zoals het voorbereiden en presenteren van adviesrapporten aan C-level executives, het begeleiden van workshops en het afnemen van interviews.
Naast het samenwerken met collega‚Äôs uit de adviespraktijk, werk je mogelijk ook samen met consultants uit andere disciplines zoals Business Engineering, Data & AI of Transformation om de klant optimaal te ondersteunen.
Naast klantprojecten werk je ook op kantoor aan nieuwe voorstellen en draag je bij aan de expertise van IG&H.
Wat levert het jou op?
Naast uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden biedt werken bij IG&H je een steile leercurve aan het begin van je carri√®re. Naast leren in de praktijk krijg je volop trainingen om je consultancy- en people skills te versterken via onze Junior Academy. Je krijgt een betrokken coach toegewezen die je begeleidt. Daarnaast biedt IG&H je een inspirerend kantoor in Utrecht, een onge√´venaarde werksfeer, en volop feestjes, teamactiviteiten en sportevenementen.
‚ÄúWanneer je start als business analyst, neem je deel aan de IG&H Junior Academy. Dit programma helpt je om je volledig te ontwikkelen tot consultant. Tegelijkertijd pas je deze vaardigheden direct toe in klantprojecten met je team. Naast het formele programma zijn er veel leuke informele activiteiten en uitjes met je mede-analisten. Deze combinatie was voor mij erg waardevol en heeft geleid tot veel nieuwe vriendschappen.‚Äù

‚ÄúVanaf dag √©√©n kreeg ik veel verantwoordelijkheid en heb ik aan een breed scala aan projecten gewerkt, van strategische planning tot praktische implementatie. Dit zorgt voor een dynamische en leerzame werkervaring. In combinatie met de ondersteunende en samenwerkende cultuur bij IG&H draagt dit sterk bij aan zowel professionele als persoonlijke groei. Deze ervaringen, samen met talloze informele activiteiten, maken IG&H de perfecte werkgever om je carri√®re te starten.‚Äù

IMPACT BRANDS has already positively impacted the lives of 3 million people worldwide. Join us as a remote IT System Tracking Intern and let‚Äôs impact billions together!

Junior Accountant
.
¬†
Jouw functie
¬†
Als Junior Accountant ben je een belangrijke schakel tussen de finance afdeling en andere teams binnen de organisatie. Je start in een functie waarin je boekhoudkundige taken combineert met projectmatig en communicatief werk en waarin je op termijn kan evolueren naar een allround finance rol naarmate jij en het bedrijf verder groeien.

Het opstellen van en opvolgen van de facturatie, op basis van projectinformatie en input van collega's overheen diverse afdelingen.
Je communiceert proactief met interne teams om ontbrekende facturatiegegevens van een project te verzamelen.
Je controleert of alle verkregen informatie klopt wat betreft budgetten en contractuele afspraken. Daarna ga je aan de slag met het inboeken van inkomende en uitgaande facturen.
Je beoordeelt, verwerkt en controleert kritisch de onkostennota's volgens interne richtlijnen.
Verder ondersteun je bij de maandelijkse afsluitingen en bereid je rapportages voor.
Als junior accountant kan je op termijn een bijdrage leveren aan de optimalisatie van de financi√´le processen en tools en je schouders mee zetten onder diverse aspecten binnen de finance afdeling.
Bij onze organisatie krijg je de kans om mee te bouwen aan de verdere groei van het bedrijf en jezelf te ontwikkelen tot een waardevolle, breed inzetbare finance professional.

Ben jij een (startend) elektrotechnisch talent met een passie voor complexe technische gebouwen in de onderzoeks-, onderwijs- en cultuursector? Als (Junior) Electrical Engineer binnen de Unit Real Estate krijg je de unieke kans om deel te nemen aan inspirerende en innovatieve projecten die bijdragen aan een duurzame toekomst. Lees verder en ontdek wat deze rol voor jou in petto heeft!
¬†
De uitdaging
¬†
Als Electrical Engineer ben jij onderdeel van de Unit Real Estate. Je werkt aan het elektrotechnisch ontwerp binnen uitdagende projecten in de onderwijs-, onderzoeks- en cultuursector. Hierin kan je complexiteit combineren met maatschappelijke waarde. Je maakt deel uit van multidisciplinaire projectteams en werkt samen met collega‚Äôs van andere disciplines, zoals werktuigbouwkunde, bouwfysica en duurzaamheid. Je krijgt de kans om je te ontwikkelen, zowel inhoudelijk als professioneel, terwijl je praktische oplossingen bedenkt die echt impact maken.
¬†
Tot je verantwoordelijkheden behoren:¬†
Je denkt mee in de conceptfase van projecten.
Je werkt onderdelen van het installatieontwerp uit, zoals energievoorziening, verlichting, zwakstroominstallaties, communicatie- en beveiligingssystemen.
Je maakt veelvoorkomende berekeningen, zoals kabel- en verlichtingsberekeningen.
Je werkt met software zoals Revit (BIM) en DiaLux om ontwerpen te realiseren.
Je ondersteunt in de communicatie naar de klant en het ontwerpteam.
¬†
Het team
¬†
Je komt te werken in een hecht team van jong tot oud. Je kernteam bestaat uit circa 10 collega‚Äôs die goed op elkaar ingespeeld zijn met elk hun eigen achtergrond en expertise. Dit team is onderdeel van de Unit Real Estate met in totaal circa 40 collega‚Äôs. Ons team levert de best passende oplossing voor nieuwbouw, renovatie of transformatievraagstukken, voor overheden, bedrijven en instellingen van nagenoeg iedere schaalgrootte. Geen project is hetzelfde! In de projecten werken wij bij voorkeur veel samen met andere afdelingen binnen Deerns, zoals onze expertisegroepen en buiten de landsgrenzen. Van integrale en complexe opgaven worden wij enthousiast!
Dit ben jij
¬†
Een afgeronde opleiding in HIT-E, elektrotechnisch ontwerpen, energy technology of een aanverwant vakgebied met HBO of WO werk- en denkniveau hebt.
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal (zowel geschreven als gesproken); Engels is een pluspunt.
Met jouw creatieve en praktische kijk op elektrotechniek draag je bij aan slimme en duurzame oplossingen.
Je werkt nauw samen met je collega‚Äôs en bent een teamspeler die goed kan luisteren naar de behoeften van opdrachtgever.
Een positieve, proactieve houding en de ambitie om je te ontwikkelen in het vakgebied
Dit bieden wij
¬†
Een functie van 32-40 uur per week met een bijpassend salaris.¬†
Uitdagende projecten voor toonaangevende opdrachtgevers in Nederland en internationaal.¬†
Een werkomgeving waarin innovatie en duurzaamheid dagelijks in de praktijk worden gebracht.¬†
Aandacht voor jouw eigen ontwikkeling en vitaliteit met ruime opleidings- en ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden, fiets- en sportregelingen, flexibele werkuren, 33 vakantiedagen en mogelijkheid tot aankopen van extra dagen.¬†Samen met je teamleider en coach/ buddy werk je actief aan je ontwikkeling.
Hybride werken, waarbij je de mogelijkheid hebt om afwisselend thuis en op kantoor te werken.¬†
Een team waar samenwerking en collegialiteit voorop staan en waar we informeel met elkaar omgaan.¬†
Duurzaamheid zit in onze genen. Dit uit zich bijvoorbeeld in een mobiliteitsbeleid waar gezondheid en duurzaamheid voorop staan. Veel van onze kantoren liggen bij OV-knooppunten, fietsen wordt aangemoedigd en je reiskosten worden 100% vergoed op basis van OV.¬†
¬†
Over Deerns
¬†
Deerns is als onafhankelijk ingenieursbureau gespecialiseerd in advies, ontwerp en uitvoeringsbegeleiding op het vlak van installatietechniek, bouwfysica, energievoorziening en duurzaamheid. Onze expertises dragen bij aan duurzame, intelligente en toekomstbestendige gebouwen die de processen van onze opdrachtgevers optimaal ondersteunen. We zijn verantwoordelijk voor het ontwerp van de installaties en het realiseren van een goed comfort en een prettig klimaat in de meest uiteenlopende gebouwen; van kantoren, tot luchthavens en van ziekenhuizen tot datacenters.¬†
¬†
Daarnaast is Deerns benoemd als Great Place to Work!
¬†
Kennis maken?
¬†
Wil je meer weten over werken bij Deerns?‚ÄØNeem dan contact op met Maarten Borgmeijer (Corporate Recruiter) via +31 6 11 66 75 44. Wil‚ÄØje meer weten over de inhoud van de functie? Neem dan contact op met Rik Maaijen (Unit Director) van Real Estate via +31 6 10 47 21 16.
¬†
Ben je enthousiast geworden? Reageer met jouw cv via de sollicitatie button. Je‚ÄØontvangt binnen drie werkdagen een reactie. Acquisitie naar aanleiding van de vacatures op onze website wordt niet op prijs gesteld. Cv's en/of voorstellen die ongevraagd aan ons worden gemaild worden niet in behandeling genomen!

Job Title: Junior Accountant AR  (maternity cover 1 year contract)
Job Description:
At 
Kuoni Tumlare
, we deliver truly inspiring and innovative solutions and experiences that create value both for our Partners and Society at large. Our wide portfolio of products and solutions is built on 100+ years of destination management experience.
Our solutions include series tours, technical visits, educational tours, Japanspecialist travel consulting, as well as meetings, incentives, conferences, and exhibitions. Our product portfolio includes MyBus excursions at destinations as well as guaranteed departure tours devised and delivered by our Seat-in-Coach specialists, Europamundo (EMV) and MyBus Landcruise.
We cater to a wide range of customer needs in close collaboration with our trusted suppliers and powered by our team of destinations experts - enabling us to make a real difference to the world.
Our global Finance function acts as a driver of integration across our businesses, operating across four central principles: global Finance functions provide subject matter expertise; local finance ensure operational execution according to local requirements; global process owners for are in charge of standardization & optimization; and the St. Petersburg Finance hub performs transactional finance activities.
As
 Accountant¬†AR
 you proactively collaborate with other departments, local accounting offices, the Finance hub in St. Petersburg, business stakeholders and external agents on all company receivable and credit control issues. You support timely and accurate process delivery, diagnosing issues, cascading them to responsible departments and implementing solutions to increase process efficiency.
Furthermore, you help monitoring the accounts receivables and related AX accounts to make sure that the open balances are existing and valid.
In this role you report to the Head of Finance & Accounting (Switzerland) and coordinate closely with other local AR offices around the world as well as stakeholders within own business area of responsibility.

Financieel Medewerker (0,8-1,0 FTE)
die ons team komt ondersteunen bij het beheer van onze groeiende markten in Duitsland en Zweden.
Wat ga je doen?
Als Financieel Medewerker ondersteun je de verantwoordelijke financials bij de administratie van BusinessBike Germany en BMS Zweden. Je bent een onmisbare schakel in de dagelijkse operatie van het Finance Operations team.
Je werkzaamheden bestaan uit het controleren en verwerken van inkoop- en verkoopfacturen, het klaarzetten van betalingen en het ondersteunen bij de periodieke afsluitingen. Het is een dynamische rol waarin je veel leert over internationale geldstromen. Je werkt nauw samen met ervaren collega‚Äôs Amersfoort, waarbij je de ruimte krijgt om stap voor stap meer verantwoordelijkheid te nemen en mee te denken over hoe we onze processen slimmer kunnen inrichten.

Job Title: Finance & Administration Internship in the Lomography Headquarter
Job Description:
Lomography is a globally active organization dedicated to experimental and creative analogue photography. Originally established in 1992 by a group of offbeat students as an art movement, but fuelled by fiery passion and burning curiosity, the Lomographic Society soon grew to become the creative and innovative international company it is today.
We develop, market and distribute our products via worldwide photo stores, design stores, museums and lifestyle stores, as well as via our Lomography websites available in 17 languages which besides the online shop also host photo magazines and platforms for an international community of over one million Lomographers. Lomography regularly hosts events and exhibitions. The Lomography headquarters is in Vienna and has subsidiaries in London, Paris, NY, Tokyo, HK, Shanghai and Manila.
For our headquarters in Vienna we are offering an internship in Finance & Administration. In this very interesting role, you will be part of our dynamic international Finance and Administration team and get the chance to gain practical knowledge and valuable experience from your colleagues in controlling, accounting, logistics, IT and other departments.
Are you currently in your education and motivated to add valuable practical experience to your theoretical knowledge in a dynamic F&A team? If you're also interested in photography and a creative lifestyle, then now it‚Äôs a great opportunity for you to apply for an internship with us!
Learning Objectives and Tasks
Developing an understanding of how ERP and reporting systems function
Maintaining master data in IT systems (customers, prices, orders, etc.)
Learning operational routines in ERP systems
Participating in the creation and evaluation of reports, processing ad-hoc analyses and target/actual comparisons
Working with large datasets and "big data" for analysis
Recognizing and understanding business relationships within the company
Cost analyses and research on cost-related issues
Accounting tasks (accounts payable, accounts receivable, and bank accounting; account and balance reconciliation)

We are looking for a motivated and organized individual ready to learn the ropes of processing, scanning and printing analog photos at Lomography¬¥s photo lab at its Vienna HQ! Help, learn and take over more responsibilities after your internship is over! 
As an intern for the LomoLAB at Lomography, your duties will include:
operate a minilab (film development, scanning, image processing, printing)
customer service for film services
servicing the Minilab
communication with service technicians
help with stock / consumption / order management of material needed
perform backend operations for online lab fulfillment such as order checks and photo uploads
assist other tasks during slow times in the lab, like film and development tests, hand-spooling film, repairs and marketing the LomoLAB

Are you a creative mind with ambition, combined with great organization skills and a sure feeling for design? Do you enjoy challenges and want to work in a multicultural work environment? If you‚Äôre also passionate about Lomography products, don‚Äôt miss the opportunity and apply for this Internship!
We are looking for a motivated individual, who has fun spreading Lomography‚Äôs way of life and wants to be part of the whole process- from the development of an idea to its realization.¬†
As an intern for the Graphic Design department at Lomography, your duties will include
Development of layouts for flyers, print materials and visual merchandising materials
Adaptation of graphics on marketing materials and display for retail and fairs
Co-ordinate content and materials for projects
Creating print ready files
Design of product and camera graphic
Updating print materials and packaging
Scanning and archiving old print materials
Maintaining and improving our digital archive

ABOUT US
Lomography is a globally active organization dedicated to experimental and creative analogue photography. Originally established in 1992 by a group of offbeat students as an arts movement, but fuelled by fiery passion and burning curiosity, the Lomographic Society soon grew into an international venture.
Our snapshots are characterized by vibrant colours, surprise effects and pure spontaneity. We have over a million creative members across the world and invite you to let loose, ignite your inspiration and to catapult your shots around the globe through our online platform. Whether you‚Äôre a complete novice or a seasoned pro, everyone can harness the photographic power to create something incredible. Don‚Äôt think ‚Äì just shoot!
RESPONSIBILITIES
Research and contact potential retail partners from the cultural, lifestyle, design,¬†photography, fashion, music industries throughout Central & Eastern Europe (with a focus on Poland, Romania, Czec Republic).
Research on potential distribution and B2B incentive¬†opportunities in Central & Eastern Europe
Work closely with the sales, logistics and finance teams to process B2B orders
Assist the sales¬†team in creating sales, marketing and training materials for retail customers
Support the execution of sales & marketing campaigns and strategies worldwide
Update international marketing and sales materials for internal use
Reaching out to press contacts and managing the press database in Central & Eastern Europe
Writing and publishing features on the Lomography online magazine
Help to coordinate the Lomography Community in Central & Eastern Europe

Your Profile

Welkom in de nieuwe praktijk
Nog niet zo lang geleden liep er een man ons kantoor binnen met een gitaar onder zijn arm. Hij had een lied geschreven voor Manometric. Voor het eerst in drie jaar kon hij weer spelen. Dankzij een kleine, perfect passende handbrace.
Dat is wat wij bouwen. Bij Manometric ontwerpen en produceren we op maat gemaakte ortheses met eigen 3D-scantechnologie, slimme software en schaalbare productie. We werken direct samen met ziekenhuizen en klinieken in heel Nederland en breiden uit naar Duitsland.
Naarmate we snel groeien, wordt onze operatie ook complexer: planning, productie, logistiek en klinische samenwerking moeten functioneren als √©√©n geheel. Daarom zoeken we een Junior Operations Manager. Iemand die energie krijgt van structuur aanbrengen, overzicht cre√´ren en processen stap voor stap verbeteren.
De rol die jij speelt bij onze groei
Als Junior Operations Manager ben je een centrale schakel in het dagelijks functioneren van onze orthopedische teams. Jij zorgt ervoor dat planningen kloppen, processen soepel lopen en data inzicht geeft in waar we kunnen verbeteren. Je werkt nauw samen met orthopedisch technologen, operations en cli√´ntcontact teams. Door jouw overzicht en initiatief kunnen collega‚Äôs hun werk beter doen en krijgen pati√´nten sneller de juiste zorg. Jij bent verantwoordelijk voor:
Planning en operationele co√∂rdinatie
Jij neemt ownership over de planning en het organiseren van de inzet van onze orthopedisch technologen. Je bewaakt capaciteit, lost knelpunten op en zorgt dat afspraken effici√´nt worden ingepland.
Proces en data verbetering
Je analyseert data, bouwt dashboards en vertaalt inzichten naar concrete verbeteringen. Je neemt eigenaarschap over operationele KPI‚Äôs en helpt processen slimmer en schaalbaarder te maken.
Dit ga je doen
Maakt planningen voor orthopedisch technologen en optimaliseert capaciteit
Co√∂rdineert afspraken, orders en verwijzingen
Bouwt dashboards en monitort KPI‚Äôs
Analyseert waar processen beter kunnen en initieert verbeteringen
Ondersteunt operations bij projecten en procesoptimalisatie
Schakelt met interne teams om knelpunten snel op te lossen
Zorgt voor overzicht en structuur in een snelgroeiende omgeving

Welcome to the new reality of care
At Manometric, we‚Äôre transforming orthoses and prosthetics from medical necessities into products people actually want to wear. That requires smart technology and thoughtful design. From our proprietary 3D scanners to radically new brace concepts - everything starts with a strong idea - and an even better execution.
How you create meaningful change in healthcare
As an intern within Manomeric you‚Äôll be part of the team developing our orthosis and scanner portfolio. Together with engineers, software developers and external partners, you‚Äôll work on products that directly impact people‚Äôs lives. You‚Äôll have access to cutting-edge 3D technology and the freedom to rapidly prototype, test, and bring ideas into production.
You have a broad skillset from concept development to engineering and production. You are hands-on: you are not afraid to get your hands dirty and know your way around the workshop. You‚Äôll work closely with experienced industrial designers and you will have the opportunity to learn from them on all levels of product development.
Ready for an internship where you have the opportunity to both develop yourself and make a real impact on peoples lives? We look forward to meeting you.
What you‚Äôll be doing
Design (parts of) medical products from start to finish: from initial idea to production-ready in close collaboration with senior members of the team.
Think conceptually, prototype, test, and improve based on user insights.
Take ownership of projects, making a real impact on peoples lives.
Collaborate with our internal healthcare team and get in contact with our patients to test your assumptions quickly.¬†
Work with and develop your skills with tools such as Rhino, Fusion360, Figma, Adobe and Keyshot or equivalent.

The role
We are now seeking a highly motivated 
Junior Customer Success Manager 
to join us in Milan. You will operate at the intersection of customer success and early-stage sales activities. The role involves supporting customer adoption while proactively engaging potential new customers through outbound initiatives.
Responsibilities:
Support customer onboarding and adoption in complex, technical environments, working alongside Solution Architects and Engineers.
Act as a first point of contact for customers on product usage, basic technical questions, and best practices.
Monitor customer usage, engagement, and health metrics to proactively identify risks and opportunities.
Conduct outreach activities (via structured sequences with emails, cold calls, linkedin messages) to engage potential new customers and support pipeline generation.
Qualify inbound and outbound leads, understanding customer needs and technical context.
Participate in discovery calls and demo sessions.
Align the BU manager and the Sales manager in periodic pipeline check-ins.
Ensure a smooth handover between Sales, Pre-Sales, and Customer Success phases.
Collect and share customer feedback with Product and Engineering teams to drive continuous improvement.
Maintain accurate customer and prospect information in the CRM system.
Support reporting on customer success and commercial metrics (e.g. adoption, satisfaction, retention, early pipeline indicators).
