Moore Law is een advocatenkantoor met een rechttoe rechtaan karakter: korte lijnen, snelle beslissingen, no-nonsense cultuur en veel ondernemerszin. Wij bieden medewerkers zinvol werk in een kantoor dat dicht bij de klant staat en een brede dienstverlening biedt. .

Description
Mr. Marine is a 
TICC
 (‚ÄúTesting, Inspection, Certification and Compliance‚Äù) service provider in the maritime industry, focused on electrical-mechanical shipboard equipment.¬†¬†
Since 2002, Mr. Marine has been serving ships worldwide. With a global network of 150 technicians present in 350+ ports, we ensure vessels‚Äô safety and compliance 24/7, delivering excellent customer service, and exceeding our customers‚Äô expectations.¬†

Why Mr. Marine?

You will enter various Mr. Marine Academy training programmes to ensure your fast development within the company. Individual study hours and on-site training are part of the job.

Meer dan 100 jaar geleden bracht Nikon zijn eerste microscoop op de markt. Sindsdien ontwikkelen we geavanceerde microscopen, stimuleren we technologische innovatie en ondersteunen we wereldwijd baanbrekend onderzoek. Onze belangrijkste klanten zijn universiteiten, ziekenhuizen, onderzoekscentra en farmaceutische en biotechbedrijven.

Junior Field Service Engineer
 voor de regio Midden/Zuid Nederland. In deze rol ben jij verantwoordelijk voor het installeren, onderhouden en repareren van onze microscopie¬≠systemen. Jij zorgt ervoor dat onze klanten altijd kunnen rekenen op betrouwbare en nauwkeurige apparatuur, zodat hun onderzoek en klinisch werk ongestoord kan doorgaan. Onze business groeit snel en onze klanten verwachten service van topniveau. Natuurlijk willen we ervoor zorgen dat onze microscopen doen wat we beloven. Daarom is jouw rol als Field Service Engineer ontzettend belangrijk.
Je wordt onderdeel van een klein maar zeer ervaren team. Je krijgt veel ruimte om te leren en je te ontwikkelen tot een allround specialist. Omdat je werkt met complexe systemen, is geduld belangrijk. Je groeit stap voor stap in de rol en wordt daarbij goed begeleid.
Wat ga je doen?
Je voert (pre-)installaties uit van microscopie-oplossingen, inclusief software, bij klanten op locatie.
Je voert preventief en correctief onderhoud uit aan standaard en later complexere microscopie systemen, zoals widefield en confocal microscopen op locatie of in onze workshop op kantoor.
Je analyseert problemen en lost deze zelfstandig op.
Je houdt administratief overzicht van servicecases in onze CRM-omgeving.
Je onderhoudt sterke relaties met klanten en ondersteunt hen bij vragen over apparatuur en prestaties.
Je herkent kansen voor servicecontracten en aanvullende producten of diensten

sterk;

Over Normec
Normec, opgericht in 2016, is een ambitieuze, onafhankelijke en snelgroeiende organisatie met een Buy-&-Build-strategie gericht op testen, inspectie, certificering en compliance (TICC). Door deze specialisatie kunnen organisaties veilig, effici√´nt en kosteneffectief innoveren. Tot nu toe zijn er meer dan 75 overnames voltooid in 9 landen en werkt de organisatie binnen 4 divisies.
Normec zet in op zowel organische groei als strategische overnames en bouwt partnerschappen die verder gaan dan de standaard aanpak. Elk project draagt bij aan een gedeelde, duurzame toekomst. Medewerkers krijgen de kans om bij te dragen aan deze missie en zich te ontwikkelen binnen een dynamische en snelgroeiende omgeving. Zo cre√´ren we impactvolle oplossingen voor klanten en een duurzame toekomst.
Advipro ondersteunt haar klanten in de farmaceutische, biofarmaceutische, medische en hightech sector bij het realiseren, het optimaliseren en het in stand houden van hoogkwalitatieve projecten en processen. !

We are looking for a (Junior) Marketing Manager to join our international Marketing Team and start your career as Marketing-Allrounder.
Your Mission
In this role, you will support marketing activities across the entire Northwave Group, with a focus on the DACH region. You will help organise campaigns and events, create content, and ensure smooth marketing operations. Additionally, you will take ownership of projects such as Employer Branding and Internal Communications, working closely with HR and other teams to strengthen our brand and engage employees. 
Your Responsibilities:
Supporting the marketing team with daily tasks and international projects
Coordinating marketing activities and maintaining materials for global use
Assisting with online and offline campaigns, events, and fairs
Creating content for internal channels (e.g., newsletters, intranet, Slack)
Collaborating with HR on employer branding initiatives
Ensuring our marketing efforts are consistent across regions by researching and analysing relevant industry information and staying on top of Marketing trends and strategies
You will be part of the Northwave Group Marketing team and work closely with colleagues in Germany and the Netherlands. Together with over 275 security enthusiasts, you help companies protect themselves against cyberattacks.
What can you expect from us?
Contract
First things first: you will receive a permanent employment contract with 30 days of holiday per year. You can organize your working hours flexibly in consultation with your colleagues and customers.
Development
What do you want to achieve and what support do you need? You will receive regular training and guidance to help you reach your professional goals. At Northwave, you can continue to grow.
Team
Respect and appreciation are important to us ‚Äì both as professionals and as people. The best way to get to know your colleagues from the Netherlands, Germany, Austria, Belgium, and Sweden is by joining one of our many activities, such as a trip to a theme park or a joint triathlon.
Equipment
You will receive a modern MacBook and iPhone. Our offices have height-adjustable desks ‚Äì and our CEO loves to kit us out with cool merchandise üòÑ
Mobility
For your commute, you can choose between a Deutschlandticket or a JobRad ‚Äì it‚Äôs up to you.
And what else...
No, the fruit basket in the office is not a benefit for us, but a matter of course ‚Äì just like coffee, tea, and lemonade. Have you ever tried Dutch caramel waffles?

Job Title: Junior Customer Engagement Specialist (f/m/x) - Dutch Market
Job Description:
Position: Junior Customer Engagement Specialist (f/m/x)
Location: Madrid, Spain
Market Focus: Dutch-speaking customers
About Otovo
Otovo is a leading European renewable energy company making solar installations and energy storage accessible to homeowners. We operate across multiple European markets as a publicly listed company, combining stability with a fast-growing, international environment.
Role Overview
As a Junior Customer Engagement Specialist, you are the first point of contact for Dutch-speaking customers, guiding them from initial inquiry through post-sale support. You manage leads, book appointments, assist customers with documentation, and ensure smooth handoffs to the installation teams, delivering a professional and friendly service experience.
Key Responsibilities
Contact and qualify Dutch leads quickly and professionally.
Explain Otovo‚Äôs solar solutions and Care Product clearly
Book meetings with the Sales Team and guide customers through next steps.
Manage inbound calls and first response through our CRM tool (Hubspot)
Support customers with document submission and follow-ups.
Track project progress and act as a bridge between customers and internal teams.
Requirements
Dutch fluency required; English proficiency essential.
Customer-focused mindset with strong communication skills.
Organized, proactive, and able to follow structured processes.
Comfortable with CRM tools and basic office software.
We Offer
Salary: ‚Ç¨20,350 + uncapped commission
Corporate benefits, restaurant and transportation benefits
Private healthcare
Language classes
Hybrid work model
Up to 4 weeks remote work per year
Free fruit and beverages at the office
Opportunities to grow in an international, fast-growing company

Job Title: Operations Intern ‚Äì Energie Rinnovabili & Progetti Sostenibili (f/m/x)
Job Description:
Operations Intern
Sei una persona dinamica, organizzata e appassionata di progetti innovativi e legati al mondo delle energie rinnovabili? Stiamo cercando un* brillante 
Operations Intern
 che si unisca al nostro team Operations in Italia. Avrai un ruolo chiave e attivo nelle operazioni quotidiane e supporterai le fasi realizzative dei progetti, contribuendo al nostro obiettivo di rendere l'energia pi√π pulita, accessibile ed economica.
Chi siamo
Otovo √® una tech company leader in Europa nella vendita e installazione di soluzioni per l‚Äôefficientamento energetico. Fondata a Oslo nel 2016, siamo presenti in 10 Paesi e dal 2021 siamo quotati alla Borsa di Oslo. La nostra missione √® rivoluzionare il modo in cui le persone consumano energia, offrendo soluzioni sostenibili, efficienti e convenienti.
Grazie alla nostra tecnologia all‚Äôavanguardia, offriamo ai clienti la possibilit√† di ottenere in modo semplice e veloce un‚Äôofferta per impianti fotovoltaici e pompe di calore, collegandoli con installatori qualificati. Entra a far parte di un team giovane e innovativo, in un ambiente stimolante e ricco di opportunit√† di crescita!
Le tue responsabilit√†
Come 
Operations Intern
, collaborerai a stretto contatto con tutti i dipartimenti di Operations in Otovo, assicurando il massimo supporto su varie fasi del processo, sia pre che post installazione.¬† In dettaglio, ti occuperai di:
Affiancare il team di Technical Support nella risoluzione delle problematiche post installazione, coordinando le attivit√† dei nostri Service Partners e assicurando comunicazione continua ai clienti coinvolti.
Supportare il team di Project Management nel coordinare la realizzazione degli impianti fotovoltaici, gestendo pratiche, documentazione e permessi necessari, oltre che entrando in contatto diretto con clienti e installatori partner.
Aiutare il management nella preparazione di report e analisi volte a migliorare i processi e ad aumentare l‚Äôefficienza operativa del team.
Gestire tasks trasversali in caso di necessit√† e bisogno su tutte le aree di competenza del team di Operations.
Chi cerchiamo
Spiccate capacit√† organizzative e di gestione del tempo.
Approccio analitico, multitasking e orientamento ai risultati.
Eccellenti capacit√† relazionali e comunicative.
Problem solving, pensiero critico e capacit√† decisionale.
Ottima conoscenza dell‚Äôinglese (livello B2-C1) per collaborare con il team internazionale.
Spirito di squadra e passione per le sfide innovative.
Non √® richiesta un‚Äôesperienza pregressa nel settore: riceverai formazione tecnica durante l‚Äôonboarding.
Cosa offriamo
Missione sostenibile:
 il tuo lavoro contribuir√† attivamente a combattere il cambiamento climatico promuovendo soluzioni di energia pulita.
Team straordinario:
 entra a far parte di un team internazionale giovane, appassionato e in rapida crescita.
Flessibilit√† lavorativa:
 possibilit√† di smart working dopo il periodo iniziale di onboarding e formazione.
Location strategica:
 uffici moderni nel cuore di Milano.
Compenso per lo stage:
 compenso mensile lordo compreso tra ‚Ç¨500 e ‚Ç¨800, in base al numero di ore settimanali.
Tipologia di contratto
Stage curricolare o extracurricolare full-time.
Processo di selezione
Dopo uno screening iniziale, parteciperai a colloqui per conoscerci meglio e valutare l‚Äôallineamento con la nostra mission e il ruolo ricercato. La maggior parte delle fasi del processo di selezioni si svolger√† da remoto, con una fase finale in presenza.
Unisciti a noi e contribuisci a plasmare un futuro pi√π sostenibile!

ABOUT REIZ TECH
Reiz Tech is more than just an IT company. We are a trusted end-to-end IT advisor throughout clients‚Äô business lifecycle. We have a growing global presence in more than 30 countries and regions, united to deliver end-to-end IT solutions. Our talents work together remotely, and low leadership levels are decentralized for better communication, decision-making, and flexibility.¬†
ABOUT THE ROLE
The purpose of this position is to act as the pivotal intermediary between senior business stakeholder groups and IT, ensuring that intricate business requirements are meticulously translated into robust IT solutions.
Applications are open for candidates from EU countries only.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Elicit and analyze business and system requirements.
Describe requirements in a structured manner and at a sufficient level of detail; use visual models (diagrams, mockups, etc.) where beneficial.
Identify gaps, risks, and improvement opportunities ‚Äî not just document requests.
Facilitate discussions and align understanding across stakeholders, developers, and testers.
Support product discovery, solution design, and delivery within a cross-functional product team.
Validate implemented solutions and ensure real business value is delivered.
Prepare documentation and guides, and occasionally support training or client communication.
¬†
REQUIREMENTS

Selected Clients
AVIS, BEAT, Jumbo, Kaizen Gaming, Zakcret, Mothercare, Porsche, Hondos Center, Public, Brown Hotels, Celestino, Agnotis, Prince Oliver, YAMAHA, Zeus & Dione, UNICEF Greece, Benaki Museum.

Our Principles
At Relevance, we focus on six core principles through which we cultivate our culture, promote excellence and evolve: Diversity - Knowledge - Innovation - Execution - Humility - Ownership.
Our company's core purpose is to provide an environment for employees, clients and ourselves to flourish and throughout our eleven-year long lifetime we have heavily invested time & resources in building and maintaining a strategy, structure and methodology with one goal in mind; Growth. We have also managed to create an inspiring working environment in which our people can perform and develop by guiding and being guided.
We Hire for Attitude and train for Skill
We see every recruit as a next important building block for our company and search for well-rounded professionals with diverse backgrounds and an insatiable appetite for knowledge. Subsequently, we passionately invest in their skill-set development by: (1) providing a comprehensive product education orientation (2) setting performance related targets that impact their end of year salary increase, reinforcing at the same time meritocracy, (3) supporting an open space culture to nurture knowledge sharing.
As a Junior Graphic Designer you will:
Create engaging digital artwork for various projects and clients while maintaining brand consistency
Design visuals for Google Ad campaigns and social media posts that align with client goals and brand identity
Work with senior designers to create high-quality ads and social media visuals, while gaining insight into designing for impact across digital platforms.
Bring fresh, creative ideas to the team while staying within brand guidelines
Stay up to date with current design trends and new tools, bringing innovative ideas to enhance client projects
Collaborate with the creative team to develop and execute design concepts effectively

As a working student you‚Äôll gain valuable hands-on experience while completing your studies. You‚Äôll work in small data-driven teams in a very international context, with a performance and learning program that will accelerate your growth.
Do you want to gain relevant working experience while studying? We are always looking for rockstar students as part-time data engineers, data scientists, and data/consulting analysts. 
We're also always happy to hear from you if you think Rotate could help you in case of an internship or a research thesis. So please reach out to us with topic ideas that would work for you, your university and that would be relevant to air cargo!
Who we are
We are Rotate. We help key players across the global air cargo and logistics industry make better commercial and strategic decisions. We provide cloud-based software and analytics, world-leading market data, and data-driven strategy consulting. Our clients include top-tier airlines, airports, freight forwarders, governments, shippers, investors, and other industry stakeholders.
Founded in 2022 by a core team of former aviation strategy consultants, Rotate has grown rapidly. We now have offices in the Netherlands and Malaysia and a diverse team of around 50 professionals, including strategy consultants, data scientists, software developers, and data engineers. Demand for our work continues to grow strongly, and we are therefore looking for talented students to strengthen our team.
What you‚Äôll do
We are looking for a talented students to help us design, build, implement, execute analyses. You will be working along Rotate‚Äôs fulltime engineers, scientists and consultants to:
Build data-driven solutions in collaboration with airlines around the world.
Design, implement and manage data pipelines that ingest vast amounts of data from various sources.
Plan technical solutions and deploy the data architecture using cloud-based technologies.
Make data available, execute pipelines and scale sets for data science.
Analyse large datasets and present findings to internal and external stakeholders.
Build thought leaderships analyses to share with the world.
Why work at Rotate?
At Rotate, you‚Äôll join a fast-moving team that‚Äôs tackling an endless stream of fascinating problems in an industry that‚Äôs essential to the global economy. We build high-impact products and strategies using modern technologies, and we‚Äôre committed to tailoring your personal and professional growth as we scale. Our performance management and learning programs are all about helping you grow, with coaching and mentorship on a daily basis.
In addition to excellent compensation, you‚Äôll get to:
Build things that matter.
 Solve complex problems in a critical industry. Advise clients on their most fundamental strategic questions, or partner with airlines to co-develop data-driven SaaS products with the latest technology stack. Drive efficiency and sustainability in global supply chains.
Write your own story.
 Feel like an entrepreneur within a well-funded company and established team. Help us build Rotate and share in our joint success. Partner with us to tailor your development and career ambition.
Live unforgettable experiences.
 Get exposed to different cultures, go on unforgettable offsites, experience the highs and lows of scale-up life‚Ä¶and if you‚Äôre keen, travel the world and eat sushi in Tokyo!

Make legal technology accessible to everyone
At Saga, we're building the intelligence that helps lawyers think faster, work smarter, and stay in control of their craft. Our AI platform blends legal reasoning with machine precision to make complex work simpler, sharper, and more human.
We're gaining momentum. Lawyers rely on us for critical work every day, and our growth is accelerating. We're opening a new role that connects product, tech, and customers - someone who'll help us scale without losing what makes us great.
Your role as Customer Success Engineer
You'll sit between our customers and our product, making both better. As our first dedicated Customer Success Engineer, you are the main technical point of contact for customers and internal teams when it comes to product questions, integrations, and platform behaviour. You help legal teams get real value from our AI platform by solving issues fast, preventing recurring problems, and feeding real world insights back into the product. You work hands on with logs, APIs, workflows, and edge cases, always with the end user in mind. This is a builder role. You are not stepping into a finished support machine. You help design how support works, what good looks like, and how we scale it without losing quality.
What you‚Äôll do:
Act as the first point of contact for technical questions and product issues
Debug and reproduce customer facing issues and escalate when needed
Investigate logs, errors, API requests, and AI workflow behaviour
Translate customer pain points into clear insights for Product and Engineering
Create and maintain technical documentation, guides, and solution examples
Work closely with Engineering, Legal Research, Product, and Infra teams
Improve onboarding and self serve support to reduce inbound tickets over time

At Saga, we're building the intelligence that helps lawyers think faster, work smarter, and stay in control of their craft. Our AI platform optimises legal workflows and enables lawyers to focus on what matters the most - people, ethics, and impact. We're expanding into new markets across Europe, and DACH is a strategic priority. We're hiring a Junior Sales & Account Executive to lead our entry into the DACH region, building the market from scratch, establishing relationships with leading law firms, and driving revenue growth in one of Europe's most important legal markets.
Your role as Junior Sales & Account Executive
As our first presence in the DACH region you‚Äôll open a market, build partnerships, and establish how law firms experience AI for the first time. Every relationship you build, every deal you close, and every network you activate becomes the foundation for Saga's growth in the DACH region. You drive the full sales cycle. You map the German & Austrian legal market and identify priority targets, law firms, legal networks, and innovation hubs. You initiate outbound prospecting and qualify opportunities. You conduct needs-based consultations and deliver tailored demos that address local legal workflows, compliance requirements, and professional standards. You guide prospects through trials and negotiations to closed deals, working closely with our CCO and local partners. You gather market intelligence on compliance positioning - professional secrecy, GDPR, German Bar requirements, and provide feedback that shapes how we localize our approach.

Who are we?
With over $2B in revenue, 80+ manufacturing facilities across 6 continents and over 7,000 employees worldwide, Signode is a leading manufacturer of a broad spectrum of transit packaging consumables, tools, software, and equipment that optimize end-of-line packaging operations and protect products in transit.

Job Title: Internship: Assembling and Testing of Equipment for DAC Sorbent Lifetime Analysis
Job Description:
We are Skytree
Skytree enables a transition to a world with cleaner Air for everyone. We do this by developing and deploying smart technology that captures atmospheric carbon dioxide, enabling its use or storage to combat climate change and aid society and businesses around the world.
Born out of the European Space Agency (ESA), we are a global team of highly talented scientists, engineers and business professionals, supported by an experienced management team. Our working culture is based on a dynamic and smart approach to business with an open and understanding attitude to others and a desire to expand the boundaries of what is possible.
As we enter a new phase of growth, we‚Äôre excited to welcome a driven 
Assembly and Testing Intern 
to learn, grow, and go on this journey with us!
The project
Skytree builds modular and scalable technology for Direct Air Capture (DAC) of CO2 to combat climate change. As part of that technology, we design, develop, and build filters for CO2 capture using a sorbent material. Depending on the conditions of incoming air, the conformation of the filter, and the operating time, the DAC performance may decrease over time. However, our machines need to operate for extensive periods of time in the field without our filter material losing its performance. Therefore, it is crucial to investigate the influence of different factors (temperature, pressure, etc.) on the sorbent lifetime.¬†
To do so, we have built a custom setup for accelerated lifetime testing, as well as a setup for performance testing of our DAC sorbents. Based on use of these setups, we have identified areas for improvement in performance, accuracy, and user-friendliness of these systems. We have designed the next generation of the set-up for lifetime analysis. In this internship project, the goal is to work together with the Testing and Infrastructure Engineers team on assembling the set-up, developing control software, designing and performing test routines and getting the set-up ready to be handed over to the RnD team.¬†
NOTE:  
This internship duration is  3-6 months, full-time, 40 hours /week.
The start date is ASAP.
This position does not meet the criteria for employer sponsorship therefore, we are unable to support work permit or residency applications. 
You‚Äôll make an impact by:
Building novel experimental equipment: assembling the gas supply, vacuum system and electrical components, designing, running and documenting the testing procedures.¬†
Creating user-friendly control software: the setup will be controlled by a custom-built software (built in DAQFactory SCADA suite). Part of this internship project will be to build the software operating sequences, design the UI and optimize the automation routines.¬†
Learning Objectives:
Gain real-life hands-on experience building hardware and software for a novel experimental set-up.
Get exposed to a cutting-edge science of DAC sorbent materials through daily interactions with a multidisciplinary team of scientists and engineers.¬†
Understand the inner workings of a dynamic clean-tech startup that prioritizes scientific and engineering excellence.

We are facing a real challenge and we are looking for the right person to join our adventure.
The use of digitalization technologies and Artificial Intelligence in the world of healthcare reveals great opportunities to benefit and improve patient‚Äôs care, reducing costs and improving global health. We can find many medical areas that are already getting the benefits of this new wave, however, others like hematology, infectious diseases, neglected tropical diseases, among others, still remain one step behind. SpotLab is fighting to bridge the gap.
We have received more than 10 international awards, including the Seal of Excellence of the European Union, being one of the most innovative start-up companies based on breakthrough innovations with scale and impact potential. We are a multidisciplinary orchestra with gender parity where developers, engineers, doctors, business managers, etc. with different professional backgrounds interact and complement each other.
We are offering an Artificial Intelligence Research Internship in Madrid, who will help to¬†develop, train and deploy machine learning and image processing algorithms for health.

WHO WE ARE?
Being the daughter company of Swisscom - leading telecommunications company and one of the most sustainable and innovative companies in Switzerland - we share the same values, vision and goals.
As a trustworthy and efficient Swisscom IT service partner, we create valuable customer experiences. We work in a strong collaboration with our Partners in Switzerland and attract and retain high performers.
We're expanding our footprint in Riga and actively seeking 50+ DevOps Engineers to join our growing teams within this year.
We invite driven professionals to join us, grow with us, and help shape the future.
The team/project:
Swisscom‚Äôs Martech crew manages a sophisticated marketing technology stack that delivers cross-brand, multi-channel, and AI-driven personalized experiences. Data quality, governance, and integration are central to this work. At Swisscom, we are also developing a modern data mesh platform to enable sustainable, rapid, and governed value extraction from data. Joining our team means contributing to the seamless integration and sharing of data between the marketing stack and the broader data mesh, tackling complex challenges, and collaborating with talented engineers in an innovative, forward‚Äëthinking environment.¬†
You will:
 
Extend and integrate the Martech platform
 within Swisscom‚Äôs distributed data mesh architecture.¬†
Monitor and optimize platform performance
, driving improvements and enhancing profile identification techniques across all communication channels.¬†
Design and document data structures
 to enable business teams to effectively generate insights, build audiences, and activate both inbound and outbound marketing use cases.
¬†
What we offer:
Salary from 1600 to 2900 EUR monthly gross
80 EUR monthly cell phone and internet allowance
Flexible schedule and possibility to work in hybrid mode
Ergonomic home office allowance in value of 500 EUR
Possibility to work abroad for 4 weeks each year
Health Insurance ‚Äì includes gym or pool/aquatic fitness membership, issued after 1 month, and covers consultations with a psychologist or psychotherapist
Optics (200 EUR every 2 years)
24 working days of annual paid holiday per year
5 dedicated paid learning day‚Äôs annually
Day off on your birthday or names day
1 day off for social activities (voluntary project, adopting an animal)‚Äã
Collaborative, friendly and driven work environment
Work on innovations, cutting edge technologies and in autonomous high performance teams
Parking options
Continuous development environment that fosters your growth (conferences, cross-department experience sharing, learning platforms etc.)
Annual salary review

Are you ready to play a key role in Teamleader‚Äôs growth story in Germany? We‚Äôre looking for a versatile and driven colleague eager to help build our presence in a new and promising market ‚Äî someone excited to be part of the early growth phase and shape our success in Germany.
This is a unique opportunity to help expand Teamleader‚Äôs German footprint ‚Äî from first customer contact to a successful start ‚Äî with the potential to grow into a full-cycle sales or onboarding expert.
Who are we and why should you care?
Teamleader is a 
SaaS scale-up
 born in 2012 in Ghent, Belgium, and 
part of the Visma Group
 since 2022. Our mission? To make work easier, 
not harder
, for small and medium-sized businesses.
Teamleader offers a suite of five products, two of which are expanding their presence in the German market:
Teamleader Focus
 ‚Äì Our all-in-one solution designed to help small businesses streamline their CRM, project management, and invoicing processes.
Teamleader Orbit
 (launched in 2019) ‚Äì Tailored for medium-sized agencies, Orbit empowers teams to scale efficiently and manage complex operations with ease.

Curious to learn more about us, our products, and 
why you‚Äôll love working at Teamleader
? Check us out 
here
.
Why others chose Teamleader
We‚Äôre lively, not corporate. We combine the energy of a startup with the maturity of a scale-up. You‚Äôll work in a fast-paced tech environment with approachable managers, lots of feedback, and room for ownership.

key role in the German expansion 
of Teamleader. While generating potential leads and following up on them, you'll be speaking with key stakeholders in the agency market on a daily basis.
You will explore ways to generate 
sales growth
You inspire small to medium-sized companies to 
digitize their workflow
. You can use different methods to reach your audience (phone calls, social selling, mails, WhatsApp, LinkedIn, etc.). We will provide you with the tools and training to excel in your job.
You will also be working together with the marketing team to help them identify and pursue the right targets and prospects.
You'll work closely together with the Sales/Account Executives as you will schedule the first meeting for them and brief them in the most efficient way so that you can work towards your common goal: help agencies to work smarter.
When you start working, you will get an in-depth training. You learn everything about us, our story, your colleagues, our workflow-tool and you get an in-depth sales onboarding. Learning by doing, that is our motto. You will be part of a team that loves to work together, help each other, share insights and achieve success. Before you know it, you'll be having your first conversations with potential customers and we'll celebrate your first deal together!

A competitive, market-conform salary with 
extra benefits.

extensive training budget
 to help you grow your skills and career.

personal tooling budget

Sport initiatives and events to keep your energy high.

well-being
, connection, and real impact.

Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance
At Tether, we‚Äôre not just building products, we‚Äôre pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses‚Äîfrom exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs‚Äîto seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.
Innovate with Tether
Tether Finance: 
Our innovative product suite features the world‚Äôs most trusted stablecoin, 
USDT
, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.
But that‚Äôs just the beginning:
Tether Power: 
Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.
Tether Data: 
Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like 
KEET
, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.
Tether Education
: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.
Tether Evolution
: At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.
Why Join Us?
Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you‚Äôre passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We‚Äôve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.
If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.
Are you ready to be part of the future?

Working closely with a highly skilled, cross-functional team, you will learn by doing‚Äîcontributing to real projects while developing your creative, technical, and conceptual skills. This role is ideal for someone eager to grow in a high-performance environment, curious about AI-driven creative tools, and excited to be part of a team shaping the future of digital experiences and the ongoing digital revolution.

About the job
We are looking for talented individuals to join us for an internship in 2025/2026. MSc/PhD Internships at Tether aim to provide students with the opportunity to actively contribute to our products and research, and to the organization's future plans and emerging technologies.
In our team, you will have the opportunity to participate in the development of the state-of-the-art (SOTA) foundation models, and will also be responsible for optimizing our distributed model training framework continuously.
PhD internships at Tether provide students with the opportunity to actively contribute to our products and research, and to the organization's future plans and emerging technologies. Our dynamic internship experience blends hands-on learning, enriching community-building and development events, and collaboration with industry experts.
Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. We encourage you to apply early. Please state your availability clearly in your resume (Start date, End date).
Responsibilities
Research and develop state-of-the-art LLM and/or video or multimodality models to accelerate open-source progress in the domains.
Implement the application of large models in our business scenarios, like pre-training, supervised fine-tuning, post-training, inference etc.
Continuously optimize the training framework to better adapt to the training of large models on thousands of multi-node GPUs.
In this role, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to advance the development of open-source LLM, vision and/or multimodal foundation models and products. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with broader teams across Tether.

Heb jij de basis onder de knie en ben je klaar om meters te maken in de techniek? Wil je niet blijven meelopen, maar zelf aan de slag gaan. Met deze rol krijg je het vertrouwen en de ruimte om te groeien naar zelfstandigheid ‚Äì met hulp van een monteur als je dit nodig hebt.
Jouw baan
Als junior servicemonteur maak je de stap van meedoen naar zelf doen. Je voert zelfstandig onderhoud uit aan liften. Je lokaliseert storingen, lost ze op en voert kleine reparaties uit. Je werkt volgens de juiste richtlijnen en denkt mee aan verbeteringen. Uiteraard ben je nog in ontwikkeling ‚Äì maar waar het mogelijk is, krijg je de vrijheid om je werk zelf in te delen. Je supervisor en collega‚Äôs staan voor je klaar wanneer nodig. Jouw groei staat centraal.
Wie zijn wij
TK Elevator Netherlands BV behoort met op dit moment circa 280 medewerkers tot de grotere liftbedrijven in Nederland en installeert, onderhoudt, en repareert liften, roltrappen en automatische deuren van uiteenlopende aard en omvang. TK Elevator Netherlands B.V. is op weg om de beste serviceorganisatie voor liften, roltrappen en automatische deuren in Nederland te worden.

Job Title: GER | Experienced Consultant or Junior Manager Risk & Balance Sheet Management
Job Description:
Who we are
True North Partners LLP is an independent consulting firm with presence in Amsterdam, Dubai, Frankfurt, Johannesburg, Lisbon, London and Madrid, Singapore. We have extensive global experience and industry recognition in the financial services, risk management and finance communities.
True North Partners is uniquely distinct from the typical consultant firms due to the following:
Being a boutique consulting firm focused on risk, finance and strategy, we deliver innovative concepts and methodologies based on specialist experience and analytical backgrounds
Working across multifaceted competencies of risk, finance and strategy we overcome the traditional silo thinking and offer client-specific solutions as well as sustainable implementation development strategies
Being people driven we allow members of all levels to actively participate in the running and development of our young firm
What we offer 
Our company is built for and around its people. It is part of our culture for each member of the firm to take part in the running and development of True North Partners such as business development, marketing and management tasks. A sense of ownership for the firm is a central tenet to our overall behaviour. In particular, we offer:
Challenging projects with leading financial institutions around the globe, where we are at the fore-front of innovation in products and methodologies
A motivating, inspiring and team-oriented work environment with co-workers from a variety of hemispheres and backgrounds
The opportunity to help shape a unique, professional environment with flat hierarchies and superior career opportunities

Job Title: Junior Sales & Key Account Manager ‚Äì Germany
Job Description:
Would you love to sell to and service the best Golf Facilities, Golf Coaches, Club Fitters, and Pro/Amateur Players in Germany? Are you ambitious, self-driven and willing to go the extra mile? Then you should join our Trackman Golf sales team!
Since the very beginning, Trackman has benefited from the skills and commitment of exceptional people. As always, we are looking for the very best talent to take our success story to the next level. As a Trackman Representative, you will demonstrate and sell Trackman products and services within the territory.
Trackman A/S is a fast-growing sports technology company that develops, manufactures and sells 3D ball flight measurement systems for a variety of sports verticals. Originally developed for golf, Trackman now enjoys a market leader position in several sports disciplines in measuring and delivering real-time sports motion data.
Job Responsibilities:
Find, plan and deliver product demonstrations to golf clubs, golf professionals, indoor simulator centres, club fitters, ambitious amateurs and other client segments on a continuous basis.
Generate leads leveraging all communication channels including cold calling, workshops, golf events and social media activities.
Demand generation through cooperation with the local PGA and other golf organizations.
Ensure the highest customer satisfaction through ongoing training and service.
Customer training and 1st level support.
Organization and implementation of Trackman University educational workshops.
Product testing and provision of feedback to our software and hardware development teams.
Development and continuous improvement of your territories sales strategies.

About TransPerfect
¬†
TransPerfect Legal Solutions (TLS)
 is the industry leader in multilingual legal support services. Since 1992, we have been providing a comprehensive suite of solutions that facilitates every aspect of our clients' legal matters. From court reporting and e-discovery for litigation to virtual data rooms for M&A and bankruptcy cases, TLS is a one-stop-shop for the global legal industry. As a specialized division of TransPerfect Inc., the world's largest privately owned language services provider, we are the only legal support services provider that also offers a full array of translation, interpretation, and other multilingual solutions.
¬†
For more than 20 years, TransPerfect has provided comprehensive language and technology solutions to help our clients communicate and conduct business more effectively in a global marketplace. Equipped with a quality management system certified to both the ISO 9001:2008 and EN 15038:2006 standards, TransPerfect provides a full array of language and business support services, including translation, interpretation, multicultural marketing, website globalization, subtitling, voiceovers, staffing services, e-learning and training, and legal support services. TransPerfect also offers a suite of next-generation technologies that significantly reduce costs and improve consistency throughout the translation process, making TransPerfect the vendor of choice for the world's leading multinationals.
With annual revenues of over $500 million, TransPerfect is the world's largest privately held provider of language services and technology solutions. From offices in more than 90 cities on six continents, TransPerfect offers a full range of services in 170+ languages to clients worldwide. With an unparalleled commitment to quality and client service, TransPerfect is fully ISO 9001 and EN 15038 certified. TransPerfect has global headquarters in New York, with regional headquarters in London and Hong Kong.
¬†
TransPerfect offers a comprehensive benefits package including: medical, dental, vision, 401k, paid time-off, company sponsored life insurance, short term and long term disability, flexible spending account options, and a pro-active and accessible HR department that focuses on the staff‚Äôs health and happiness.
¬†
TransPerfect is an equal opportunity employer.
¬†
For more information on TransPerfect¬† Family of Companies, please visit our website at 
www.transperfectlegal.com

JOB DESCRIPTION
Expected duties and responsibilities to be performed under the supervision of a Senior Project Manager
Engages with key stakeholders, product managers and team members to define version scope, work priorities, timelines, and product specific requirements.

Formalizes team protocols and complies related necessary documentation.
Liaises, streamlines and facilitates direct, honest, transparent and timely communication between all the parties involved in the development process to relay crucial updates, maintain absolute alignment & focus, and help resolve conflicts and solve problems.
Monitors and addresses product's Intra- and Inter-dependencies, as well as Risks. Assists with tracking, communicating, escalating, alarming and executing corresponding prevention, deflection, and/or mitigation strategies.
Regularly manages and updates Agile Artifacts and other project management tools (such as: Issue Board, Product Backlog, Release Scope, Weekly Reports, Knowledge Base, etc.).
Organizes and conducts Agile Ceremonies (such as: Daily Standups, Defect Triages, Feature Planning, Weekly Synchronizations, etc.).
Assists in establishing optimal work distribution, making sure all team members have adequate tasks prepared, arranged (per relative urgency and importance), and assigned to each of them.
Fosters collaboration, improves team health & dynamics, and motivates team members to successfully develop valuable solutions. Helps the team achieve business-wide awareness, self-organization, maturity, reliability, and other key characteristics of a high performing team.
Employs critical, system and design thinking to address everyday issues, resolve misunderstandings & misalignments, eliminate hinderances & obstacles, protect the team from unproductive disturbances, and mediate conflicts.
Reacts aptly to shifts in the planned project scope or timeline, identifies related issues and their root causes, and helps the team to properly adjust & adapt to any and all project changes.
Tracks down team‚Äôs progress on a daily basis, compiles relevant reports and utilizes analytics & statistics to ensure crucial decisions are both well-informed and data-driven.
Closely monitors results of the product testing effort, and actively assists the team in amending critical defects.
Adheres to and promotes operations and patterns prescribed by the Agile Methodology, and coaches on adopting and nurturing tried-and-true Agile practices.
Constantly and proactively strives to improve and optimize working procedures and processes.
Performs other tasks upon request of the Employer.

Job Title: Video Editor and Production Assistant Internship
Job Description:
Position Summary:
This is an opportunity for someone who would like to become a proficient video editor and that is interested in learning all about the video production process. You will be part of a unique Creative Team within TransPerfect that offers creative solutions to clients and other internal departments from concept to delivery. The intern will support the team with creative brainstorming sessions, carrying out administrative tasks, media management and video editing.
Position responsibilities:

Support the film crew as required during film shoots.
Assist our Video Editor creating and preparing Premier projects, string outs and first drafts.

Media management, proxies creation and organizing the server following the established structure.
Research footage, music and other assets needed in the production.
Take care of all production documents such as location and personal releases, location permits, licenses, contact lists, call sheets, production schedules, etc.

Summary:
The intern will form part of our Vendor Management department and will support and assist our Production teams with their vendor capacity needs. This department is responsible for all vendor management, engagement and certification processes. They manage TransPerfect¬¥s freelance community comprised of thousands of specialists (translators, proofreaders, DTP specialists, copywriters, subject matter experts and more) providing services to our company to assist with the successful delivery of our projects.
The intern will be able to learn and develop different skills through a valuable experience in a multicultural and dynamic environment and have the opportunity to see how a translation company works. They will be involved principally in the recruitment and onboarding of new specialists, rate negotiation and maintaining lasting relationships with our vendors.
Position responsibilities:
Search for new vendors (translators, proofreaders, medical writers, regulatory consultants, etc.): run searches in specific platforms, post jobs, contact candidates, analyze candidates‚Äô CVs, etc.
Negotiate rates with vendors according to services provided.
Set up new vendors in the Vendor Management systems: screen candidates‚Äô applications, organize paperwork and document signature collection, add vendors to our company‚Äôs systems and platforms, update systems and platforms, store vendors‚Äô documentation and test files.
Assist candidates with the certification process: offer certification tests to candidates, schedule certification tests with candidates, create certification tests in our company‚Äôs platform, schedule certification tests review, work with Vendor Managers within the team in tests review results analysis and records, keep track of vendors training records, create and maintain dashboards.
Ensure vendor information is up to date at all times on our Vendor platform.

We‚Äôre looking for a Junior Accountant for our Finance department who will help us with day to day accounting.
About Finance Team¬†
The Finance Team supports the organization by performing financial processes like collecting cash from customers, making payments to suppliers, and processing the related accounting documents. We make sure Tylko follows the tax rules and provides financial information and reports both internally and externally.
We support other departments in planning and decision-making by providing financial insight, maintaining relations with banks and trade currencies.
Once you join our Team you will be responsible for:
Sales/Revenue
: Verifying, issuing, and posting sales invoices; managing sales returns and corrections; supporting sales settlements (with Customer Support).
Cost/AP (Accounts Payable)
: Processing and booking purchase invoices; handling cost accruals and related documentation.
Compliance
: Verifying EU VIES numbers; preparing GUS and Intrastat reports; entering selected accounting documents.
General Accounting Support
: Assisting with bank statement posting and payment preparation (backup); performing account reconciliation and register analysis; supporting month-end closing.

Comprehensive healthcare
Multisport
A discount on all Tylko products
And of course, a dog-friendly office!

Job Title: Junior Market & Customer Insights Researcher (Home & Furniture)
Job Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Junior Market & Customer Insights Researcher to join our Product Team. In this role, you‚Äôll support our efforts to better understand the furniture market across Europe and help maintain our research repository.
This is an excellent opportunity for someone at the early or developing stage of their research career‚Äîsomeone who‚Äôs passionate about furniture and interior design and looking to grow in a creative, collaborative environment.
About the Team
You‚Äôll work closely with our Research Manager and Product Managers across the Tylko Product Department. As part of the early stages of the furniture development process, you‚Äôll be responsible for collecting insights on market trends, product features and competitors.
You‚Äôll engage with Tylko users across Europe and see how customer feedback is translated into concrete features and solutions. You'll collaborate with a team of experienced professionals who are passionate about what they do.
Once you join our team, you will be responsible for:
Supporting the Research Manager
Assisting with daily tasks such as meeting notes, fieldwork summaries and tracking project timelines. You‚Äôll help keep research activities organised and running smoothly.
Conducting market research
Carrying out competitor analysis, exploring customer preferences and trends and turning this information into insights and recommendations for the Product Team.
Managing the research repository
Ensuring all research data is properly stored, organised and tagged so it‚Äôs easy to access and use.
Coordinating research operations
Managing participant databases, consent forms, scheduling and supporting recruitment for research projects.
Participating in qualitative user research
Conducting in-depth interviews with Tylko customers across Europe to understand their needs and experiences (for applicants with a proven track record).
Why Tylko?
Being a part of the Tylko team goes beyond clocking in every day and keeping your head down. We celebrate inclusivity and work together to build a culture of happy, healthy employees who are truly heard, and provide the following great benefits for every single member:
One bonus day off every month
Comprehensive healthcare
Multisport
A discount on all Tylko products
And of course, a dog-friendly office!
Here‚Äôs what you can expect from our recruitment process:
Short video interview (English)
Task to be solved at home (English)
Meetings with the managers and team (Polish / English)

UN WATCH VOLUNTEER INTERNSHIPS


Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) 




What is UN Watch?¬†


UN Watch is a non-governmental organization (NGO) in Geneva, Switzerland whose mission is to monitor the performance of the United Nations according to the yardstick of its Charter and to protect human rights for all.¬†UN Watch believes in strengthening the role of democracies within the UN and in the Charter‚Äôs guarantee of equal treatment for all nations large and small.¬†UN Watch is at the forefront in the struggle against anti-Semitism and anti-Israel bias at the UN.¬†For more information, please visit 
www.unwatch.org
.


¬†


Does UN Watch offer paid internships?¬†


No, unfortunately, UN Watch cannot offer a salary to¬†interns due to¬†visa complications. The only internships we offer are on a volunteer basis. Interns must find their own funding for travel, health insurance, daily living, lodging and all other costs. Geneva is an expensive city.




Are scholarships available for UN Watch¬†interns?
Yes, a limited number of scholarships are available to top internship applicants. More information will be provided to eligible applicants during the interview process.


When are UN Watch internships available, and for how long do they last?¬†


UN Watch offers three main internship opportunities throughout the year, each of which encompasses one Human Rights Council Session:


1. Spring (February, March, April),
¬†
Application Deadline: November 30th


2. Summer (May, June, July), 
Application Deadline: December 31st


3. Fall (September, October, November), 
Application Deadline: April 30th


Interviews of qualified candidates are typically conducted in the month following the application deadline.


Interns are expected to commit to a minimum of two months and up to three months.¬†




Is it possible to intern remotely?


Yes, but only if you are within one timezone of¬†UN¬†Watch's office in Geneva (CET). This means that we unfortunately cannot take remote interns from the US or Canada. UN Watch¬†accepts remote interns dependent either on the preference of the applicant or the availability of spaces in the Geneva office. Remote interns perform nearly all of the same tasks as those physically in Geneva given that many of the UN's activities can be followed online.




What are an intern‚Äôs activities and responsibilities?¬†


The activities and responsibilities of an intern typically include a broad range of substantive and administrative research functions, and may depend on the skill set and background of the applicant. Substantive responsibilities can include research and writing of reports, drafting correspondence, monitoring and reporting on meetings at the UN, attending and reporting on meetings with diplomats and UN officials, fact-checking and taking notes. Interns also participate in all administrative responsibilities, which regularly include website maintenance, answering telephones, making photocopies and filing, events support and other office tasks.


¬†


Does UN Watch have offices outside Geneva?¬†


The only office in which internships are offered is in Geneva, opposite the European headquarters of the United Nations.

Virya Energy, founded in 2019 through the strategic partnership of Colruyt Group and its majority shareholder Korys, is a Belgian pioneer in sustainable energy solutions. Our activities span the complete energy value chain, from renewable energy development in Europe and Asia to energy distribution through DATS 24. Our portfolio encompasses our consolidated wind activities (formerly Eoly in Belgium and Eurowatt in France), solar energy projects, sustainable hydrogen development, and strategic investments in specialized energy industry services providers.
Building on over two decades of wind energy expertise and pioneering work in sustainable hydrogen, we continue to expand our capabilities. At our headquarters, a growing team of professionals drives our development across all renewable energy sectors, delivering tailored energy solutions that accelerate the energy transition.
Your role
As Legal Counsel, you will be part of the Group Legal team, supporting Virya Energy and its subsidiaries in Belgium and internationally. You will provide broad legal support on corporate, commercial and general business law matters, working closely with internal and external stakeholders across the group.
This role offers a high level of variety and exposure, combining day-to-day legal support with involvement in strategic projects across different business lines and operating units.
¬†
Your responsibilities
Providing pragmatic, business-oriented legal advice to the group‚Äôs business lines and operating units, supporting both day-to-day activities and strategic initiatives across Virya Energy and its subsidiaries.
Drafting, reviewing and negotiating a wide range of commercial agreements, including services agreements, development agreements, cooperation agreements, supply and offtake agreements, framework agreements and NDAs.
Assisting in M&A, investment and (project) financing transactions, including legal due diligence and drafting and reviewing transaction documentation such as share purchase agreements, asset transfer agreements, shareholders‚Äô agreements and financing agreements, as well as supporting post-closing implementation.
Supporting corporate housekeeping and governance matters across the group, including board and shareholder documentation, resolutions, mandates and internal governance processes.
Advising internal stakeholders on contractual risk, liability allocation and compliance, translating legal analysis into clear, workable solutions that align with business objectives.
Coordinating with external law firms and notaries, including managing mandates and following up on notarial documentation and related formalities.
Contributing to the development, implementation and maintenance of group-wide legal policies, guidelines and standard documentation, helping ensure consistency, efficiency and legal robustness across the group.
Preparing internal legal notes, memos and presentations for senior management and/or the board of directors.
Monitoring relevant developments in corporate and commercial law and proactively assessing their impact on the group‚Äôs activities.

About Vitestro
Founded in 2017 in Utrecht, Vitestro is pioneering the future of blood collection with the 
Aletta¬Æ Autonomous Robotic Phlebotomy Device‚Ñ¢ (ARPD‚Ñ¢)
. This groundbreaking medical device combines advanced multi-modal imaging (near-infrared, ultrasound, and Doppler ultrasound) with robotics and AI to perform the entire diagnostic blood draw procedure autonomously.
By addressing critical healthcare staffing shortages and improving patient experience, Vitestro is transforming one of the most common and essential medical procedures. With more than 90 team members and growing rapidly, we are scaling our impact. As we placed our first devices with customers, we are now expanding our team to ensure successful implementation and long-term reliability.
At Vitestro, we are committed to continuous innovation and improvement.
Join us as our new Electrical Engineer!
About the role
We are looking for a junior electrical engineer to join us on this journey and help us build the electronics backbone of our device. You will work closely with our electrical systems engineer and freelance electrical engineers and collaborate cross-functionally with mechanical and software engineers.
We provide you with plenty of on-the-job learning experiences.¬†
What you are going to do
Build broad expertise across the device‚Äôs electronic systems, growing into an all-round electrical engineer.
Contribute to the design, development, and validation of PCB test systems.
Support production and customer-facing teams with electrical troubleshooting and improvements.
Own cable harness documentation, including updates and ongoing development.
Execute electronics changes, upgrades, and optimizations in line with project needs.

Job Title: Store Design Junior Project Manager, UK & ANZ
Job Description:
About Charlotte Tilbury Beauty
Founded by British makeup artist and beauty entrepreneur Charlotte Tilbury MBE in 2013, Charlotte Tilbury Beauty has revolutionised the face of the global beauty industry by de-coding makeup applications for everyone, everywhere, with an easy-to-use, easy-to-choose, easy-to-gift range. Today, Charlotte Tilbury Beauty continues to break records across countries, channels, and categories and to scale at pace.
Over the last 10 years, Charlotte Tilbury Beauty has experienced exceptional growth and is one of the most talked about brands in the beauty industry and beyond. It has become a global sensation across 50 markets (and growing), with over 2,300 employees globally who are part of the Dream Team making the magic happen.
Today, Charlotte Tilbury Beauty is a truly global business, delivering market-leading growth, innovative retail and product launches fuelled by industry-leading tech ‚Äî all with an internal culture of embracing challenges, disruptive thinking, winning together, and sharing the magic. The energy behind the bran¬≠d is infectious, and as we grow, we are always looking for extraordinary talent who want to be part of this our success and help drive our limitless ambitions.
About the role
We are looking for a motivated and proactive Store Design Junior Project Manager to support the delivery of high-quality retail store projects across the UK & ANZ! This role focuses on managing projects from briefing to installation within retailers, ensuring that the Charlotte Tilbury brand is executed consistently, efficiently and in line with our operational, budget and quality requirements.
We are looking for someone who can contribute to the team culture, manage and support the delivery of projects, communicate clearly and stay highly organised. A Junior Project Manager should be a team thinker, collaborator, doer and someone who adds value through strong detail management and proactive problem solving! 
Please note, we are 2-3 days in the office (Central London) and the rest of the time you can WFH.
As a Store Design Junior Project Manager, you will
Manage and support the delivery of concession store projects including approvals, retailer coordination and supplier liaison.
Maintain our design standards across all architectural details and ensuring they are reflected accurately in retailer environments.
Preparing, owning and updating project CPAs and presenting progress back to the business.
Manage design pack submissions for internal approval and retailer sign off, ensuring accuracy and timely delivery.
Coordinate with suppliers, consultants, internal teams and retailers, keeping all stakeholders informed and aligned.
Support the review of manufacture drawings with the design team to ensure design integrity and compliance with safety standards. Assist in development and updates to design standards guidelines.
Manage all admin elements of projects including documentation, filing, tracking, purchase orders and project budgets.
Attending installations, resolving issues on site and ensuring snagging is completed to brand standard.
Support the broader team with meeting coordination, preparing decks, updating presentations and capturing meeting notes. Ensuring all project information is organised, accurate and accessible.
Who you will work with
You will report directly to our wonderful Senior Store Design Project Manager ‚Äì UK & ANZ, working alongside some highly creative and talented individuals within our wider VM & Store Design UK team.
You will also work cross functionally, with teams such as Commercial, Retail, VM, PR & Global, as well as external suppliers and partners.
About you
You have demonstrable experience in a similar role within Project Management in Store Design, alongside experience in managing the approval process for retail stores in all types of environments (Retailer Stores, Free Standing Stores).
Extensive knowledge of best practice within the construction industry including accessibility and building codes is a must.
You have an exceptional eye for detail and great vision on how to use spaces and commercial opportunities. You are skilled in the visual, written and verbal communication of design issues. 
An excellent communicator: confident and comfortable presenting, able to influence and effectively articulate your point of view. You have exceptional organisational skills and can manage multiple stakeholders with ease!
You thrive working to pace, you are able to ruthlessly prioritise and can manage multiple deadlines at anyone time with ease.
Decisive problem-solving skills with regards to construction materials and methods a must, with an awareness of design trends and materials. You have a strong understanding of basic mechanical, electrical, plumbing, and structural concepts. 
You are a self-starter, with the ability to work independently as well as part of a team to collaborate and drive team success!
You have excellent project planning and time management skills, with an exceptional eye for detail and great vision on how to use spaces and commercial opportunities. 
Ability to balance design with operational needs and budget objectives, to create exceptional store environments and customer experience. 
You are super confident using the MS Suite, with m
onday.com knowledge advantageous. You have good working knowledge of Vectorworks, AutoCAD and basic Photoshop, InDesign. 
Knowledge of best practice within the construction industry, including accessibility requirements is advantageous. 
 
Charlotte Tilbury is a fast-paced and dynamic environment where nimble mindsets, striving to deliver the best and wanting to be part of a global #dreaamteam are key. Even though we have requirements, our experience and background are just a guide, we still love to welcome applicants with more or less experience stated, provided necessary skills can be demonstrated.
Why join us?
Be a part of this values driven, high growth, magical journey with an ultimate vision to empower everyone, everywhere to be the best version of themselves
We‚Äôre a hybrid model with flexibility, allowing you to work how best suits you
25 days holiday (plus bank holidays) with an additional day to celebrate your birthday
Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents and carers throughout their parenting and caring journey
Financial security and planning with our pension and life assurance for all
Wellness and social benefits including Medicash, Employee Assist Programs and regular social connects with colleagues
Bring your fury friend to work with you on our allocated dog friendly days and spaces
And not to forget our generous product discount and gifting!
At Charlotte Tilbury Beauty, our mission is to empower everybody in the world to be the most beautiful version of themselves. We celebrate and support this by encouraging and hiring people with diverse backgrounds, cultures, voices, beliefs, and perspectives into our growing global workforce. By doing so, we better serve our communities, customers, employees - and the candidates that take part in our recruitment process.
If you want to learn more about life at Charlotte Tilbury Beauty please follow our 
LinkedIn page!

Job Title: Junior Pre-Sales Consultant (Technical Bid and Solution Specialist, German)
Job Description:
D-ploy is an 
IT
 and Engineering Solutions company with operations throughout the EMEA region including Switzerland, Germany, Czech Republic, Austria, UK, as well as the USA.
We pride ourselves on delivering innovative and superior services and solutions to numerous industry-leading clients. By building relationships and trusted partnerships within the 
IT
 community, we optimize our customer‚Äòs 
IT
 productivity and contribute to the organization‚Äôs success and value.
We are interested in talking to engaging, flexible, and solution-oriented individuals who are looking to become a part of a dynamically growing and international organization. We are focused on creating value where 
IT
 counts, join us! 
We are seeking a dynamic Technical Bid and Solution Specialist to support our bid management and solution development processes. This key role bridges technical service delivery and business development by coordinating with internal teams and contributing to the development of technical responses for customer bids. You will leverage your IT expertise to create solutions that address clients' specific needs and clearly articulate how our services deliver value.
The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of IT infrastructure, IT Technologies, service delivery, and will play a vital part in winning new contracts by ensuring our bid responses are comprehensive, technically sound, and aligned with client requirements
Tasks and Responsibilities
 
Bid Management & Coordination: Collaborate with internal cross-functional teams including service delivery, technical experts, and project managers to gather necessary information and ensure alignment of the bid response with customer requirements.
 
Technical Solution Design: Develop innovative technical solutions for client bids, utilizing your deep understanding of IT infrastructure, service management (ITIL framework), and other IT technologies.
 
Proposal Development: Write, edit, and proofread technical sections of proposals and bids, ensuring content is accurate, persuasive, and compliant with customer requirements.
 
Solution Presentation: Create and deliver compelling presentations that effectively communicate the value of our technical solutions and service delivery approach, using tools like PowerPoint.
 
Client-Centric Focus: Conduct research into client needs, competitive landscapes, and potential risks, tailoring solutions and bid responses to address specific client challenges and opportunities.
 
Compliance & Quality Assurance: Ensure that all bid submissions meet customer requirements, industry standards, and formatting guidelines. Review and improve proposal templates and boilerplate content for future use.
 
Process Improvement: Continuously update and refine proposal templates, best practices, and knowledge repositories to support a more efficient bid response process.
 
Stakeholder Collaboration: Engage with sales, technical experts, and business development teams to ensure alignment on proposal strategies, client goals, and solution delivery.
 
Risk Assessment & Mitigation: Identify potential risks in service delivery for bid responses and develop mitigation strategies to ensure successful outcomes.
 
Requirements
 
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent experience is a plus
 
Experience working in a pre-sales, solutions architect, or service delivery role within a bid or sales environment and hands on experience. 
 
Prior experience in responding to large-scale IT service delivery bids across industries such as government, healthcare, or enterprise IT.
 
 
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in bid management, technical writing, or IT service delivery, preferably within the IT services or technology industry.
 
Strong technical knowledge of IT.
 
Proven experience in coordinating and writing complex technical proposals and bids.
 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to simplify and articulate complex technical concepts clearly.
 
Proficiency in creating compelling presentations and bid documentation using tools such as Microsoft PowerPoint, Word, and Excel.
 
Ability to work independently and within cross-functional teams to meet tight deadlines.
 
Strong organizational and time management skills, with attention to detail and a commitment to high-quality work.
 
Familiarity with procurement processes and government contracting standards is a plus.
 
Fluency in English and German, spoken and written.
 
Candidates have to provide a Criminal record extract not older than three months.
 
Benefits
 
Broad range of activities, tasks, and projects
 
Flexible working conditions 
 
Minimum 5 weeks of vacation
 
Paid sick days
 
Meal vouchers
 
Vouchers (B-day voucher, wedding, and new born surprise)
 
Contributions to wellness programs (multisport card)
 
Fishing for Friends program ‚Äì our referral program
 
Refreshments in the D-ploy office
 
Further development and professional advancement 
 
Friendly and international working environment  
 
Company-sponsored events
 
Competitive salary and various benefits
 
Is 
IT
 in your DNA?
